item.description:
February 1. Steaming in company with ships of Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO on night retirement West of Nasugbu Cove. (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO = Rear Admiral FECHTELER in CGC SPENCER). While returning into cove in the morning, SAUFLEY intercepted a Japanese "Q" Boat which she destroyed with main battery at 0801, Ammunition expended, 69 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common, 275 rounds of 40M/M and 150 rounds of 20M/M. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 033 of l February 1945).

At 1039 commenced fire support mission. Fire support mission completed at 1100, No results observed. No casualties. Ammunition expended, 63 rounds 5"/38 AA Common. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 033 of 1 February 1945). Upon completion of firing SAUFLEY commenced screening to seaward of transport area.

Several torpedo boats approached from South at 2315. As boats did not identify themselves in any way, screening ships in vicinity opened fire. One boat observed to burst into flames at 2320 and the other shortly afterwards.

February 2. Screening to seaward of Nasugbu Cove transport area Luzon, Philippine Islands, (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO - Rear Admiral FECHTELER in CGC SPENCER). At 0310 Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO took departure from Nasugbu for Mindoro in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO dispatch 010715. SAUFLEY in anti-submarine screen, Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO in CGC SPENCER with USS LOUGH as escort departed and proceeded ahead independently leaving Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT EIGHT (Captain COLE in USS FLUSSER) as Officer in Tactical Command.

At 1726 SAUFLEY directed by Officer in Tactical Command to proceed independently. Entered Mangarin Bay, Mindoro, Philippine Islands and anchored at 1821. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT NINETEEN at Caminawit Point),

February 3. Anchored in Mangarin Bay, Mindoro, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT NINETEEN at Caminawit Point). During the day SAUFLEY underway to fuel and obtain ammunition and returned to anchorage at 1615.
February 4-5. Anchored in Mangarin Bay, Mindoro, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT NINETEEN at Caminawit Point).

February 6. Anchored in Mangarin Bay, Mindoro, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT NINETEEN at Caminawit Point). At 1713 underway in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO speedletter 0007A and formed Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FOURTEEN composed of LSM's 36, 205, 217 and 127 and FS's 184 and 309. Screen composed of USS SUESENS and USS SAUFLEY (Officer in Tactical Command). Took departure from Mindoro for Nasugbu at 1820,

February 7. Steaming en route from Mindoro, Philippine Islands to Nasugbu, Luzon, Philippine Islands in company with ships of Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FOURTEEN (Officer in Tactical Command in USS SAUFLEY). Arrived Nasugbu about 0900 and commenced screening to seaward of the LSM's after they were beached. During the afternoon eight army casualties were brought on board for transportation to Mindoro. At 2115 reformed Task Unit, Less FS184 and FS309 and took departure from Nasugbu for Mindoro,

February 8. Steaming en route from Nasugbu, Luzon, Philippine Islands to Mindoro, Philippine Islands in company with ships of Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FOURTEEN (Officer in Tactical Command in USS SAUFLEY). Arrived Mangarin Bay, Mindoro about 1015. Task Unit dissolved at 1019 and LSM's proceeded independently. SAUFLEY anchored off White Beach at 1148 and transferred army casualties to beach. Proceeded to fuel at 1319 and upon completion anchored in berth 116 Mangarin Bay.

At 1753 underway in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO dispatch 080245 to join Task Unit SEVENTY SEVEN POINT THREE POINT TWO composed of USS DENVER (Officer in Tactical Command - Rear Admiral BERKEY), USS MONTPELIER and USS BOISE plus screening destroyers, USS FLETCHER, USS LAVALLETTE, USS RADFORD, USS ABBOTT, USS TAYLOR, USS CONYNGHAM, USS CLAXTON and USS SAUFLEY. Took departure from Mindoro for Subic Bay at 1854, At 2045 USS CLEVELAND escorted by USS JENKINS and USS O'BANNON joined this Task Unit.

February 9. Steaming en route from Mindoro, Philippine Islands to Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands in company with ships of Task Unit SEVENTY SEVEN POINT THREE POINT TWO (Officer in Tactical Command - Rear Admiral BERKEY in USS DENVER). In the morning screened to seaward as the cruisers entered Subic Bay. SAUFLEY entered Subic Bay and anchored at 1034 reporting to Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE for duty in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO dispatch 080245.
February 10. Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE - Rear Admiral STRUBLE in CGC INGHAM).

February 11. Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE - Rear Admiral STRUBLE in CGC INGHAM). At O800 assumed ready duty.

February 12. Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands, (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE - Rear Admiral STRUBLE in CGC INGHAM). Relieved of ready duty at 0800. Lieutenant Commander Francis William SILK, 81211, USN, relieved Commander Dale Eugene COCHRAN, 75016, USN, as Commanding Officer this date. At 1200 Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT Vice Admiral BARBEY in USS BLUE RIDGE assumed duties as Senior Officer Present Afloat.

February 13. Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT Vice Admiral BARBEY in USS BLUE RIDGE). Underway at 1710 in accordance with Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE mailgram 120800 of 12 February 1945. At 1818 relieved USS CLAXTON on anti-submarine patrol station Able.

February 14. Patrolling on anti-submarine station Able off entrance to Subic Bay. USS LESLIE B KNOX relieved SAUFLEY on station at 1745. At 1835 joined Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE and took station in anti-submarine screen, (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE Rear Admiral Struble in CGC INGHAM). This Task Group en route to Manila Bay area for landings at Mariveles, Bataan Peninsula and Corregidor Island.

February 15. Steaming en route from Subic Bay to Manila Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands in company with ships of Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE - Rear Admiral STRUBLE in CGC INGHAM). At 0857 SAUFLEY proceeded to assigned screening station for the landing operation in Mariveles Harbor. At 1023 directed by Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE to join USS CONYNGHAM in screening Mine sweeps as they swept South Channel. Fired counter battery fire on Caballo Island at 1134 and again at 1641. No results observed. Ammunition expended: 50 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common and 140 rounds of 40M/M. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945).

In accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE operation order 4-45, USS CLAXTON and USS SAUFLEY operated in area South of Bataan and West of La Monja Island commencing at dark conducting interdiction fire on Mariveles and as support for own MTB's operating inside Manila Bay.

February 16. Steaming in area South of Bataan Peninsula and West of La Monja Island in company with USS CLAXTON (Officer in Tactical Command), conducting interdiction fire on Mariveles and acting as support for own MTB's operating inside Manila Bay. At 0050 relieved USS CLAXTON as firing ship. Ceased firing at 0340 when possible Japanese "Q" Boat was reported close aboard and maneuvered to evade. Ammunition expended: 24 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945).

Patrolled with USS CONVERSE until 0759 when directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE to join CGC INGHAM in company with USS CONYNGHAM and provide screen for the assault group moving from Mariveles Harbor to the landing beach on the South side of Corregidor Island. Commenced lying to off landing beach at 1000 as a stand by fire support ship. 1800 proceeded from Corregidor to Mariveles Harbor with CGC INGHAM.

At 2100 departed Mariveles in company with USS CONVERSE screening 6 LST's and 7 LSM's en route to Subic Bay.

February 17. Steaming en route from Mariveles Harbor, Bataan Peninsula to Subic Bay, Luzon Island with USS CONVERSE providing anti-submarine screen for 6 LST's and 7 LSM's. At 0246 anchored in Subic Bay. In accordance with verbal orders of Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE underway at 0627 as escort for 6 LSM's to Mariveles Harbor. Arrived Mariveles at 1000 and commenced patrolling to Southward awaiting LSM's.

In accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE visual dispatch 170140 joined USS CONYNGHAM at 1145 and proceeded to Subic Bay. Rendezvoused with 5 APD's off Subic Bay at 1445 and screened them en route to Corregidor Island. Arrived Corregidor at 1633 and detached from APD group.

At 1835 with USS CONYNGHAM formed screen for CGC INGHAM proceeding from Corregidor to Mariveles as directed verbally by Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE. Departed from Mariveles for Subic Bay at 1908 escorting CGC INGHAM and 6 APD's.

At 2131 anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands.

February 18. Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT - Vice Admiral BARBEY in USS BLUE RIDGE. At 0358 underway and went alongside USS WINOOSKI to fuel. At 0553 underway and proceeded to Corregidor. Arrived Corregidor at 0805 and assumed duties as fire support ship in company with USS CONVERSE (Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE - Commander Destroyer Division FORTY SIX). Proceeded to North Channel off Morrison Point at 0905 as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE. At 0952 commenced firing on assigned target. Ceased firing at 1000 having expended 200 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common ammunition. No casualties. Results reported excellent by shore fire control observer, (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945). Fired on beached Japanese landing barge at 1405. No casualties. Ammunition expended: 25 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common and 310 rounds of 40M/M. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945).

At 1342 directed by Shore Fire Control Party to patrol close to beach and find targets of opportunity. At 1402 near-miss about 10 yards off port beam amidships caused minor dam- age from several small fragments. No casualties. Commenced firing on points of possible origin of the fire. Observed five more splashes in water approximately 50 yards off port bow as ship turned to starboard. Checked fire at 1415 and then fired at intervals on targets of opportunity or possible hidden gun positions. Ceased firing at 1445 having expended 136 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common ammunition; 1539 rounds of 4OM/M; and 261 rounds of 20M/M. No casualties. No results observed, (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945).

Fired 50 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common ammunition at target designated by shore fire control party at 1511. No casualties. No results observed. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945).

At 1640 Sunk abandoned Japanese "Q" Boat by 40M/M fire

At 1718 observed and felt six large underwater explosions in a definite pattern approximately 500 yards astern of USS CONVERSE who had just passed approximately 1000 yards North of SAUFLEY on course East at an estimated speed of 15 knots. These explosions believed to be Japanese controlled mines. Point of the explosions was approximately 2500 yards due North of Morrison Point. No damage to either ship.

At 1833 retired from North Channel proceeded to Westward of Corregidor and commenced patrolling on courses generally North and South. Commenced night harassing illumination of Corregidor at 1943 as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE.

February 19. Patrolling West of Corregidor in company with USS CONVERSE (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE) conducting harassing starshell illumination of Corregidor. At 0123 observed large explosion on Corregidor. Believed to be an ammunition dump. Completed illumination mission at 0645 having expended 47 starshells. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945).

Assumed fire support station off Breakwater Point at 0800. Commenced firing on assigned targets at 1037. At 1215 ceased firing having expended 266 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. ammunition. No casualties. Results reported excellent by Shore Fire Control spotter. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945). USS DYSON and USS THATCHER relieved USS CONVERSE and USS SAUFLEY at 1215.

Proceeded to Subic Bay and arrived at 1500. Upon entering SAUFLEY fueled and obtained ammunition.

February 20. In Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands obtaining logistics. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT - Vice Admiral BARBEY in USS BLUE RIDGE). Anchored in berth #165 at 0010.

At 1019 underway and sortied in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE visual dispatch 192345. Returned to Subic Bay at 1123 as directed verbally by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE and anchored.

February 21. Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT - Vice Admiral BARBEY in USS BLUE RIDGE). At 0515 underway in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE dispatch 200845 and escorted LSM311 to Mariveles Harbor. Arrived Mariveles Harbor at 0855 and LSM proceeded into harbor. SAUFLEY commenced patrolling in vicinity of La Monja Island. At 0940 relieved USS DYSON of fire support duty in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE dispatch 200845. Took station one mile West of Wheeler Point, Corregidor Island and lay to. Between 1315 and 1527 fired at targets on Wheeler and Searchlight Points as directed by shore fire control party. Results reported excellent. Ammunition expended: 119 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945). Upon completion of firing, patrolled on various courses approximately two miles West of Corregidor. Observed large explosion in vicinity of Malinta Hill at 2130. Commenced firing starshells over Malinta Hill at 2133 as requested by shore fire control party. Ceased illuminating at 2140 having expended 8 starshells. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945). Commenced lying to as fire cover for USS CONVERSE and two MTB's closing beach to rescue army personnel cut off by enemy on the beach.

February 22. Lying to South of Corregidor Island, Manila Bay, Philippine Islands, as fire support for USS CONVERSE and two MTB's attempting to evacuate Army personnel cut off by landslide on the beach. (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE in USS CONVERSE). Commenced patrolling South of Corregidor at 0200, Between 0504 and 0703 fired 18 starshells as requested by shore fire control party. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945). Resumed patrol at 0705. At 0925 commenced lying to one mile South of Searchlight Point. Between 0955 and 1920 fired on designated targets on Searchlight, Wheeler and Unidentified Points. Results reported very good. Ammunition expended 980 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945). At 1921 commenced patrolling South of La Monja Island. Took station astern of USS CONVERSE at 2100.

February 23. Steaming on patrol three miles West of Corregidor Island, Manila Bay, Philippine Islands, astern of USS CONVERSE (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE). At 0312 commenced lying to two miles Southwest of Caballo Island and firing air bursts into area 800 yards East of Malinta Hill. Ceased firing at 0421 having expended 130 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common ammunition. No casualties. Results undetermined. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of February 27, 1945). Commenced patrolling four miles South of Corregidor. USS CLAXTON relieved SAUFLEY of fire support duty at 0818 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE dispatch 220910. SAUFLEY departed for Subic Bay in accordance with same dispatch and also as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE. Entered Subic Bay at 1030 took on ammunition, fueled, and anchored in berth #146 at 1756.

February 24. Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task force SEVENTY EIGHT Vice Admiral BARBEY in USS BLUE RIDGE). Underway at 0353 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE mailgram 231054. Proceeded out of Subic Bay and escorted six LSM's to Mariveles Harbor as Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FORTY ONE. Arrived Mariveles at 0812 and LSM's entered harbor, SAUFLEY patrolling to seaward. At 1000 screened four LSM's from Mariveles to Black Beach, Corregidor. At 1259 reformed Task Unit and departed for Subic Bay. Arrived Subic Bay at 1610 and anchored in berth #146 at 1657.

February 25. Anchored in Subic Bay, Philippine Islands, Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT - Vice Admiral BARBEY in USS BLUE RIDGE. Underway at 0350, reformed Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FORTY ONE, and departed for Mariveles. Arrived Black Beach, Corregidor at 0800, and sent LSM's in to beach. 1120 relieved by USS THATCHER as Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FORTY ONE and relieved USS THATCHER of fire support duty in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE dispatch 241303. Took station 1500 yards East of Hooker Point at 1220 and commenced lying to. Fired on abandoned Jap barge on beach at 1305 with heavy machine guns. Ceased firing at 1309 having expended 380 rounds of 40M/M ammunition. No casualties. Barge destroyed. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945). Entered Caballo Bay and anchored 600 yards South of Monkey Point, at 1408. At 1430, commenced neutralizing bombardment with USS CONVERSE in preparation for advancing troops. Ceased firing at 1445, having expended 244 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common ammunition. No casualties. Results reported excellent by Shore Fire Control Party. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945). At 1515 commenced firing harassing fire off Hooker Point and Eastern end of Corregidor. Ceased firing at 1550 having expended 50 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common ammunition. No casualties. Results satisfactory. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945). Proceeded out Caballo Bay at 1950, and commenced patrolling astern of USS CONVERSE South of La Monja Island.

February 26. Steaming astern of USS CONVERSE (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT THREE POINT FIVE) on patrol South of La Monja Island, Manila Bay, Philippine Islands. At 0520, observed MTB's strafing Japs in water near La Monja Island. Shifted patrol to entrance of Caballo Bay at 0715. USS CONVERSE proceeded into bay. At 0815, SAUFLEY relieved USS CONVERSE on station and anchored 550 yards South of Monkey Point, Caballo Bay. Sniped at Japs with rifles. At 1050, observed and felt very heavy explosion inland from Monkey Point. Numerous casualties apparent among own troops. At 1106, commenced firing on designated targets on Eastern end of Corregidor. Ceased firing at 1225 having expended 53 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common ammunition and 1 round of Common. No casualties. Results reported good. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 070 of 27 February 1945).

Underway at 1314, and proceeded out of Caballo Bay. Departed for Subic Bay at 1700. Entered Subic Bay at 1835, fueled, and anchored at 2031. Reported to Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT for duty.

February 27. Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT - Vice Admiral BARBEY in USS BLUE RIDGE). Underway during morning to fuel and obtain dry provisions. Returned to anchorage at 1239.

Underway at 1903 in accordance with Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT dispatch 270638 and proceeded out of Subic Bay. Took departure for Mindoro, Philippine Islands at 1921.

February 28. Steaming en route from Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands, to Mindoro, Philippine Islands. Arrived Mangarin Bay, Mindoro, Philippine Islands at 0710, fueled, and anchored at 0910. Reported to Commander LCI Flotillas for duty in accordance with Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT dispatch 260229 and formed Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT NINE POINT SEVEN. At 1610, took departure from Mindoro for Lubang Island, Philippine Islands.

source.name: USS SAUFLEY - Rep of ops in the invasion of Basilan Is, Philippines on 3/16/45
USS SAUFLEY - Rep of shore bombardment & A/S act in Ormoc Bay, Leyte Is, Philippines, night of 11/27-28/44
USS SAUFLEY - Rep of ops in support of the invaison of Zamboanga Peninsula, Mindanao Is, Philippines 3/10-16/45

item.description: October 1-5 Moored alongside U.S.S. JOHNSON in Whangpoo River, Shanghai, China. Emergency repairs being accomplished by U.S.S. DIXIE. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE in U.S.S. NASHVILLE).

October 6 Moored alongside U.S.S. JOHNSON in Whangpoo River, Shanghai, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE in U.S.S. NASHVILLE).

Underway at 1116 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO dispatch 030237 and proceeded up Whangpoo River to Standard Oil Dock. River Pilot on board. Fueled during afternoon. Entered Yangtze River at 1534. Transferred Pilot at 1810. Took station astern of U.S.S. ROBINSON at 1933 and proceeded to Fatu Anchorage, China.

October 7 Steaming en route from Shanghai, China to Fatu Anchorage, China in company with U.S.S. ROBINSON (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO).

Entered Vernon Channel entrance to Fatu Anchorage at 0604. Anchored one mile Southeast of Tinghai Harbor at 0820. During the afternoon, Lieutenant Commander SILK relieved Commander THOMPSON, Commanding Officer of U.S.S. WALLER, as Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE. His basic mission was to assist the Chinese on Tinghai Island in securing the Japanese forces, so as to render the Fatu Channel safe for passage of a convoy by 10 October 1945. In accomplishing this mission it was considered necessary to concentrate all Japanese in concentration camps under armed guards, to remove all breeches to heavy guns which could not be moved, to disarm all suicide boats (already accomplished), and to concentrate and establish Chinese control over all Japanese arms and munitions.

YMS 197 moored alongside at 1920.

October 8 Anchored one mile Southeast of Tinghai Harbor in North Bunji Channel, Chusan Archipelago, China. YMS 197 alongside. (Senior Officer Present Afloat Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY)

Lieutenant Commander SILK prepared and presented to the Governor, in Tinghai, for approval, and to the Japanese commander to obey, an order requiring the Japanese Commander to concentrate all his forces immediately in the Fishing School Buildings and the Airstrip Buildings on Chusan Island. The Chinese took charge of Japanese arms and munitions. An inspection was made of all magazines and warehouses.

October 9 Anchored in North Bunji Channel, Chusan Archipelago, China. YMS 197 alongside. (Senior Officer Present Afloat Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY)

Under the supervision of U.S.S. SAUFLEY officers, the Japanese moved to their concentration camp. The naval battery on Matson Island was inspected and demobilized.

YMS 197 underway in the afternoon and anchored in Tinghai Harbor.

October 10 Anchored in North Bunji Channel, Chusan Archipelago, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY)

Basic mission was accomplished, It was considered that the Fatu Channel inland approaches were secure.

October 11 - 13 Anchored in North Bunji Channel, Chusan Archipelago, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY)

During the three day period, the Japanese concentration camps and several outlying posts were inspected by Lieutenant Commander SILK and the Governor.

October 14 Anchored in North Bunji Channel, Chusan Archipelago, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY.)

Lieutenant Commander SILK exchanged calls with Commander YANG, CN, who arrived this date to take charge of all naval installations.

October 15 Anchored in North Bunji Channel, Chusan Archipelago, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY.)

An inspection was made of all captured naval installations, including the Japanese Garrison, by Commander YANG and Lieutenant Commander SILK.

October 16 Anchored in North Bunji Channel, Chusan Archipelago, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY.)

October 17 Anchored in North Bunji Channel, Chusan Archipelago, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY.)

Underway at 0809 to rendezvous with mine sweepers of Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE. Anchored at 1230 North of Tong Ting Island. Underway at 1445 to return to anchor- age at Tinghai. Anchored at 1819 in North Bunji Channel, Chusan Archipelago, China.

October 18 Anchored in North Bunji Channel, Chusan Archipelago, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY.)

Underway at 0814 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO dispatch 171343 of October 1945. At 1155 joined U.S.S. STARLING, U.S.S. COMPETENT, and YMS 197 in area North of Tong Ting Island. Took station astern of minesweepers as demolition vessel. Anchored at 1958 North of Tong Ting Island.

October 19 Anchored North of Tong Ting Island, Chusan Archipelago, China. (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY.)

October 19 Anchored North of Tong Ting Island, Chusan Archipelago, China. (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY.)

Underway at 0844 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO dispatch 191428 of October 1945, in company with YMS 197. Anchored at 1732 in Yangtze River mouth.
October 21 - 22 Anchored in Yangtze River mouth, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY.)

October 23 Anchored in Yangtze River mouth, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY.)

During the afternoon K. KRISTENSEN, civilian pilot, reported on board. Shifted anchorage to Fairy Flats, South Channel, Yangtze River.

October 24 Anchored in Fairy Flats, South Channel, Yangtze River, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Lieutenant Commander SILK in U.S.S. SAUFLEY.)

Underway at 0606 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO dispatch 230514 of October 1945. Proceeding to Quarantine anchorage. Fueled during the morning. Anchored at 1258 in Quarantine anchorage, Yangtze River.

October 25 Anchored in Quarantine anchorage, Yangtze River, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander ILSEMANN in U.S.S. MONONGAHELA.)

Underway at 0933 in accordance with instructions from Commanding Officer of U.S.S. DIXIE. Entered Whangpoo River at 0953 and proceeded to Shanghai. At 1207 moored to U.S.S. DIXIE between buoys number seven (7) and number eight (8) in the Whangpoo River, Shanghai.

October 26-31 Moored alongside U.S.S. DIXIE in Whangpoo River, Shanghai, China. Emergency repairs being accomplished by U.S.S. DIXIE. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Rear Admiral JOY in U.S.S. NASHVILLE.)

September 1 Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE in USS ST. LOUIS).

Underway at 0757 in accordance with Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO Underway Training Exercise Schedule for 1 September 1945. Proceeding in company with USS ROBINSON (Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO), USS WALLER, and USS PHILIP. Conducted tactical exercises while en route to firing area, During the morning conducted sleeve firing exercises consisting of runs. Upon completion of firing resumed tactical exercises. During the afternoon conducted Sleeve firing exercises consisting of runs. Upon completion of firing proceeded to Subic Bay, conducting tactical exercises en route. Stood into Subic Bay at 1622 and proceeded to fuel. Anchored at 1832.
September 2 Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE in USS ST. LOUIS).

September 3 Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE in USS ST. LOUIS).

Underway at 1658 in accordance with Commander Task force SEVENTY THREE visual orders. Sortied from harbor entrance at 1720 and conducted anti-submarine search. At 1743 formed Task Force SEVENTY THREE consisting of USS ST. LOUIS (Officer in Tactical Command, CAPTAIN GRIGGS) and USS NASHVILLE screened by USS ROBINSON (Screen Commander, Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO, CAPTAIN CAMPBELL), USS WALLER, and USS SAUFLEY. En route to Buckner Bay, Okinawa Shima.

September 4 Steaming en route from Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands to Buckner Bay, Okinawa Shima in company with Task Force SEVENTY THREE, consisting of USS ST. LOUIS (Officer in Tactical Command, CAPTAIN GRIGGS), USS NASHVILLE, USS ROBINSON (Screen Commander, Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO, CAPTAIN CAMPBELL), USS WALLER, and USS SAUFLEY.

During the morning test fired VT fuzed projectiles, At 1237 USS ROBINSON left formation to proceed independently to destination in accordance with Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE visual dispatch 040314. Commander THOMPSON in USS WALLER assumed duty as screen commander.

September 5 Steaming en route from Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands to Buckner Bay, Okinawa Shima in company with Task Force SEVENTY THREE, consisting of USS ST. LOUIS (Officer in Tactical Command, CAPTAIN GRIGGS), USS NASHVILLE, USS WALLER (Screen Commander, Commander THOMPSON), and USS SAUFLEY.

During the morning conducted exercise TWO (2) Able Modified in accordance with Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE visual dispatch 040438.

September 6 Steaming en route from Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands to Buckner Bay, Okinawa Shima in company with Task Force SEVENTY THREE, consisting of USS ST. LOUIS (Officer in Tactical Command, CAPTAIN GRIGGS), USS NASHVILLE, USS WALLER (Screen Commander, Commander THOMPSON), and USS SAUFLEY.

Entered Buckner Bay, Okinawa Shima, Nansei Shoto, at 0723 and proceeded to fuel. Anchored at 1132.

September 7 Anchored in Buckner Bay, Okinawa Shima, Nansei Shoto. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Division ONE HUNDRED FOUR in USS HAMUL).

Fueled during the afternoon. Underway at 1714 in accordance with Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE dispatch 070043. En route to the mouth of the Yangtze River, China, Steaming singly.
September 8 Steaming singly en route from Buckner Bay, Okinawa Shima to the mouth of the Yangtze River, China.

September 9 Steaming singly en route from Buckner Bay, Okinawa Shima to the mouth of the Yangtze River, China.

At 0623 anchored twelve (12) miles northeast of the Saddle Group in the approach to the Yangtze Kiang Delta, China and reported to Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO for duty. Underway at 0912 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO dispatch 082235. En route to Bonham Strait, East of Saddle Group to assist in minesweeping operations. At 1300 anchored off Bonham Strait, Parker Islands. Underway at 1907 for night retirement from Bonham Strait in company with Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE consisting of USS SAUFLEY (Officer in Tactical Command, Lieutenant Commander SILK), USS STARLING, USS TOUCAN, USS SURFBIRD, USS SHELDRAKE, USS SPEAR, and USS COMPETENT.

September 10 Steaming in company with Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE on night retirement from Bonham Strait, Southeast of Parker Islands. (Officer in Tactical Command, Lieutenant Commander SILK in USS SAUFLEY).

At 0659 directed commanding officer of USS STARLING to take charge of AM's and commence mine sweeping operations. At 0722 anchored off Bonham Strait, Parker Islands, China. Underway at 0928 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO dispatch 09160 to rendezvous with Task Force SEVENTY THREE in vicinity Barren Islands for fueling assignment. Fueled from USS ST. LOUIS during afternoon and rejoined Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE in vicinity of Parker Islands. Made night retirement from Bonham Strait.

September ll - 25 Steaming in company with Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE (Officer in Tactical Command, Lieutenant Commander SILK in USS SAUFLEY). Conducting minesweeping operations in the vicinity of the Parker Islands at the mouth of the Yangtze River, China. Task Unit anchored at intervals.

September 26 Anchored with ships of Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE (Officer in Tactical Command, Lieutenant Commander SILK in USS SAUFLEY).

At 1515 relieved of duties as Commander Task Unit SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO POINT ONE by USS WALLER in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO dispatch 250841. Underway at 1632 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO dispatch 250481. Proceeding in company with USS PC 575 to anchorage in the vicinity of Bonham Light. Anchored at 1948 southeast of Bonham Light, Parker Group, China.

September 27 Anchored with USS PC 575 southeast of Bonham Island, Parker Group, China (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Lieutenant Commander SILK in USS SAUFLEY).

Underway at 1031 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO dispatch 261320 to escort merchant vessels EDWARD B. HAINES and GEORGE HOLMES through Bonham Straits. At 1423 directed the EDWARD B. HAINES and GEORGE HOLMES to anchor. At 1523 anchored in the Yangtze River Delta.
September 28 Anchored in vicinity of Yangtze River entrance buoy, Shanghai, China (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Lieutenant Commander LAMIMAN in USS PHILIP).

September 29 Anchored in vicinity of Yangtze River entrance buoy, Shanghai, China (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Lieutenant Commander LAMIMAN in USS PHILIP).

Underway at 1242 in accordance with Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE dispatch 280417. Proceeded up Yangtze River with River Pilot on board. Entered Whangpoo River at 1455 and proceeded to Shanghai. At 1705 moored starboard side to USS JOHNSON (DE583) in USN Buoy Berth, Whangpoo River, Shanghai, China.

September 30 Moored alongside USS JOHNSON in Whangpoo River, Shanghai, China. Emergency repairs being accomplished by USS DIXIE. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE in USS NASHVILLE).

source.name: USS SAUFLEY - Rep Of AA Action, 8/15/43

item.description:
0000-0400 Moored alongside U.S.S. COLUMBIA starboard side to, berth #4, Havannah Harbor, Efate, New Hebrides. Boiler #3 in use for auxiliary purposes.
0400-0800 Moored as before.
0800-1200 Moored as before.
1200-1600 Moored as before.
1600-2000 Moored as before.
2000-2400 Moored as before.

0000-0400 Moored alongside U.S.S. COLUMBIA starboard side to berth #4 Havannah Harbor, Efate, New Hebrides. Boiler #3 in use for auxiliary purposes.
0400-0800 Moored as before. 0545 Fires lighted under #1 boiler. 0645 Commenced making preparations for getting underway. 0715 Underway standing out of Havannah Harbor on various courses and speeds conforming to channel in accordance with Commander Task Force NINETEEN'S mailgram 282300 May. Captain at the conn, executive officer and navigator on the bridge. 0730 Passed through inner submarine net. O731 Passed Hat Island on the port beam. 0751 Patrolling approaches to Havannah Harbor in preparation for sortie cruisers.
0800-1200 Steaming as before. 0815 Taking screening stations as part of Task Unit 19.1.2 composed of U.S.S. COLUMBIA, U.S.S. DENVER, U.S.S. LANG AND U.S.S. RENSHAW, Captain Beaty in COLUMBIA, officer in Tactical Command. Speed to 17 knots. 0821 Changed course to 315(T), 315(PGC), 304(PSC). 0850 Went to general quarters. 0901 Commenced high altitude sleeve runs for 5" batteries. On various courses and speeds conforming to needs of exercises. 1108 Commenced low altitude sleeve runs for 20MM and 40MM batteries, 1200 Completed firing and sleeve runs having expended 42 rounds of 5" ammunition, 24 rounds of 40MM and 80 rounds of 20MM. No casualties.
1200-1600 Steaming as before. 1236 Changed course to 295(T), 295(PGC), 283(PSC), proceeding in company with U.S.S. COLUMBIA and U.S.S. LANG to station for radar calibration firing. All engines ahead flank speed, 25 knots, 1303 Changed course to 270(T), 270(PGC), 259(PSC). All engines ahead standard speed, 17 knots. Commenced scheduled exercise. 1330 Changed course to 090(T), 090(PGC), 076(PSC). 1341 Commenced firing main battery. 1350 Ceased firing; expended 19 rounds 5"/38 Cal. AA common projectiles, 19 cartridges SPD 2805. 1426 Exercise completed; formed cruising disposition #1. 1450 Changed course to 080(T), 080(PGC), 068(PSC) Commenced zig-zagging on plan #10. 1521 Ceased zigzagging. 1531 Changed course to 060(T), 060(PGC), 048(PSC). 1555 Patrolling off entrance to Havannah Harbor on various courses.
1600-2000 Steaming as before. 1620 Made all preparations for entering port. Steering various courses and speeds conforming with channel. 1650 Moored starboard side to port of U.S.S. KASKASKIA. 1657 Commenced taking fuel. Draft forward 11'9", draft aft 13'10". 1723 Fueling completed draft forward 12'0", draft aft 14'1". 1730 Underway in accordance with Commander destroyer Squadron FORTY-THREE dispatch 290155. Captain at conn proceeding to ready duty buoy. 1807 Assumed ready duty, moored to listening buoy Hilliard channel. Standing by with boilers #2 and #4 on mainline.
2000-2400 Moored as before.

0000-0400 Moored to ready-duty buoy, Havannah Harbor, Efate Island. Boilers #2 and #4 in use.
0400-0800 Moored as before. 0500 commenced making preparations for getting underway. 0558 Relieved of ready duty by U.S.S. LANG, underway, standing out to sea in accordance with Commander Task Force ELEVEN Mailgram 021250, Captain at the conn, standard speed 15 knots, (151 R.P.M.), steering various courses and speeds conforming with the channel. At 0629 steadied on course 270(T), 270 (PSG), 262 (PSC), speed 20 knots (206 R.PM.). At 0632 changed course to 000 (T), O00 (PSG), 352(PSC), maintaining station 3000 yards on port beam of U.S.S. RENSHAW. At 0723 changed course to 090(T), 090(PSG), 082(PSC), took station 3000 yards on starboard beam of U.S.S. RENSHAW. At 0737 changed course to 080(T), 080(PSG), 069(PSC).
0800-1200 Steaming as before. 0825 changed course to 040(T), 040(PSG), 031(PSC). 0915 changed course to 060(T), 060(PSG), 047(PSC). 0934 changed course to 000(T), 000(PSG), 355(PSC). 0952 general quarters. 1046 changed course to 180(T), 180(PSG), 163(PSC). 1035 Secured from general quarters and damage control drill.
1200-1600 Steaming as before. 1300 changed course to 215(T), 215(PSG), 201(PSC). 1400 changed course to 245(T), 245(PSG), 235(PSC). 1500 changed course 280(T), 280 (PSG), 273(PSC).
1600-2000 Steaming as before. Changed course to 320(T),320(PSG), 315(PSC). 1615 changed course to 330(T), 330(PSG), 325(PSC). 1623 changed course to 000(T), 000(PSG), 356(PSC). 1649 maneuvering on various courses and speeds preparing to enter harbor. 1725 Passed through outer antisubmarine net. 1750 moored to U.S.S. KASKASKIA, starboard side to. 1756 Commenced fueling. Draft forward 11'10", Draft aft 13'11". U.S.S. RENSHAW moored to port. 1842 Completed fueling. Draft forward 12'1",. Draft aft 14'2", Received 13,460 gallons fuel oil at 60 F.
2000-2400 Moored as before.

0000-0400 Moored starboard side to U.S.S. KASKASKIA, U.S.S. RENSHAW moored starboard side to port in berth #8 Havannah Harbor, Efate, New Hebrides #2 boiler in use for auxiliary purposes.
0400-0800 Moored as before. 0430 Fires lighted under boiler #4. 0505 Boiler #4 cut in on main steam line. 0530 Boiler #2 cut in on main steam line. 0540 Commenced making preparation for getting underway. 0550 U.S.S. RENSHAW got underway and stood out of harbor. 0600 Underway in accordance with Commander Carrier Division TWENTY TWO letter of June 1, 1943. Captain at conn standing out of Harbor through Hilliard Channel steering various courses and speeds conforming with channel. Standard speed 15 knots(151 R.P.M.). 0626 Passed through outer submarine net steadied on course 280 (T), 280(PSG), 276(PSC), speed 15 knots(151 R.P.M.), commenced sortie in accordance with Commander Task Force ELEVEN, cruising and tactical instructions of March 1, 1943. 0713 U.S.S. SUWANNEE and U.S.S. CHENANGO standing out through submarine nets, commenced taking screening station #3 in accordance with cruising disposition #10, of Commander Task Force ELEVEN, Cruising and Tactical instructions of March 1, 1943. 0730 Changed course to 315(T), 315(PSG), 312(PSC), changed speed to 16 knots (162 R.P.M.). 0735 Commenced zig- zagging in accordance with Plan #6.
0800-1200 Steaming as before. 0846 Ceased zigzagging. 0852 Commenced taking station for air operations, 1055 Ceased air operations. 1102 Changed course to 270(T), 270 (PSG), 266(PSC). 1109 Changed course to 320 (T), 320(PSG), 316(PSC). 1122 Commenced zigzagging according to plan #10.
1200-1600 Steaming as before, 1220 Changed course to 120(T), 120(PGC), 105(PSC). Commenced air operations. 1246 Commenced zigzagging on plan #30. 1255 Ceased zigzagging. 1337 Changed course to 280(T), 280(PGC), 274(PSC). 1354 Changed course to 320(T), 320(PGC), 316(PSC). 1420 Changed course to 130(T), 130(PGC), 116(PSC). 1455 Ceased air operations, Changed course to 080(T), 080(PGC), 065 (PSC). 1520 Made preparations for entering port. 1537 Commenced patrolling off entrance to Havannah Harbor, 1550 Entering port; steering various courses to conform to channel.
1600-2000 Steaming as before on various courses at various speeds conforming to channel. 1631 Moored port side to U.S.S. LACKAWANNA. 1639 Commenced fueling. Draft before fueling forward 12', aft 13'11". 1650 Completed fueling. Draft after fueling forward 12'0", aft 14'1". Received 8450 gals. standard navy fuel. 1656 Underway following various courses at various speeds to assigned berth. 1709 Anchored in berth #13, 90 fathom of chain to port anchor. 1718 Died out fires in #4 boiler #2 boiler in use for auxiliary purposes.
2000-2400 Anchored as before.

0000-0400 Anchored in berth #13, Havannah Harbor, Efate, New Hebrides Islands with 90 fathoms of chain to port anchor. Boiler #2 in use for auxiliary purposes.
0400-0800 Anchored as before. 0530 commenced making preparations to get underway. 0700 underway on various courses and speeds standing out of Havannah Harbor Efate conforming to the channel in accordance with Commander Desron-22 mailgram 010001 June. Captain at the conn, executive officer and navigator on the bridge. 0709 passed through submarine net. O722 passed Hat Island abeam to port. On various courses and speeds in company with USS WALLER, USS LANG, and USS RENSHAW patrolling entrance to Havannah Harbor in preparation for sortie of carriers.
0800-1200 Steaming as before. 0805 Maneuvering to take proper station in anti submarine screen for Task Force-ll Carriers, USS SUWANEE guide, and USS CHENANGO base course 270(T), 270(PGC) 261(PSC). 0823 Changed speed to 19 knots. 0824 Commenced zig-zagging. 0915 Commenced maneuvering for flight operations on various courses and speeds conforming to signals from the OTC. 0950 Ceased air operations on various courses and speeds resuming normal screening stations base course 190(T), 190(PGC), 182(PSC), speed 15 knots. 1021 Commenced maneuvering for air operations on various courses and speeds conforming to signals from OTC. 1037 Ceased flight operations changed course to 120(T) 120(PGC), 112(PSC) proceeding to normal screening station speed 15 knots. 1058 Commenced zigzagging. 1132 Commenced maneuvering for flight operations on various courses and speeds conforming to signals of OTC. 1158 Completed flight operations.
1200-1600 Steaming as before. 1239 Changed course to 340(T), 340(PGC), 325(PSC). 1330 Changed course to 130(T), 130(PGC), 114(PSC); commenced flight operations. 1400 Completed flight operations. 1530 Left T.F. #11. 1536 Changed course to 090(T), 090(PGC), 075(PSC). 1543 Made preparations for entering port. 1553 All engines stopped; lying to to receive pilot aboard. 1555 Pilot Hickey, Lt. (jg), U.S.N.R. came aboard. 1557 All engines ahead standard, 15 knots. Pilot at conn.
1600-2000 Steaming as before. 1618 Standing in through submarine net, steering various courses and speeds conforming with channel. 1640 Anchored in Fila Harbor, Fila New Hebrides Islands, 20 fathoms of water, 45 fathoms of chain to port anchor. On following bearings, Front Range 083, Church 099, Flagstaff 127. 1655 secured boiler #2, boiler #8 shifted to auxiliary steam line.
2000-2400 Anchored as before.

0000-0400 Anchored in 20 fathoms of water, 45 fathoms of anchor chain at water edge, in Fila Harbor, Efate, New Hebrides, #8 boiler in BS for auxiliary purposes.
0400-0800 Moored as before. 0430 Fires lighted under #2 boiler. 0505 #2 boiler cut in on auxiliary steam line. 0520 #2 boiler cut in on main steam line. 0530 #3 boiler cut in on main steam line. Commenced making preparations for getting underway. 0545 Lieutenant (jg) Hickey, navy pilot reported on board. 0600 Underway in accordance with Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY-TWO dispatch 050318 and Commander Third Fleet dispatch 040425. Pilot at the conn navigator on bridge, proceeding down channel standing out from Fila Harbor, steering various course and speeds conforming with channel. Standard speed 15 knots (151) R.P.M. 0625 Pilot left ship, Captain at conn. Commenced sortie, forming screen 30 degrees on each bow of S.S. KOTA AGOENG. Steadied on course 105(T), 105(PSG), 092(PSC), speed 16 knots(160 R.P.M.).
0800-1200 Steaming as before. 1020 Changed course to 075(T), 075(PGC), 067(PSC).
1200-1600 Steaming as before. 1200 Position: Latitude 17-54-00 S., Longitude 169-15-00 E.
1600-2000 Steaming as before, 1825 Ceased zigzagging resumed base course.
2000-2400 Steaming as before. Latitude 17-22-15 S., longitude 170-19-00 E.

0000-0400 Steaming on base course 075(T), 075(PGC), 061(PSC), escorting Netherlands steamship S.S. KOTA AGOENG. Speed of advance 13.5 knots patrolling 3000 yards ahead on various courses at 16 knots, standard speed 15 knots. Boilers #2 and #3 in use.
0400-0800 Steaming as before. 0459 Exercised crew at general quarters. 0530 Secured from general quarters. 0540 Commenced zigzagging plan #12.
0800-1200 Steaming as before. 0813 changed base course to 255(T), 255(PGC), 245(PSC). Changed speed to 18 knots. Left the S.S. KOTA AGOENG she continuing on course 075(T). Commenced zigzagging in accordance with plan #10. 0833 Changed speed to 19 knots. 0800 Position, latitude 16-47, longitude 173-47-30.
1200-1600 Steaming as before. 1531 Exercised at damage controls; set condition of readiness, material condition afirm. 1200 Position, latitude 17-06-30, longitude 172-44-30.
1600-2000 Steaming as before.
2000-2400 Steaming as before. 2010 Lit fires under boiler #4. 2012 Secured fires under #3 boiler. 2015 Changed base course to 264(T), 264(PGC), 254(PSC), changed speed to 14.5 knots. 2000 Position, Latitude 17-41-00 S, longitude 170-23-00 E.

0000-0400 En route Havannah Harbor, Efate Island on course 264(T), 264(PGC), 254(PSC), Standard speed 15 knots, steaming at 14 knots. Boiler #2 and #4 in use, zig- zagging in accordance with plan #10. 0100 Changed course to 270(T), 270(PGC), 260(PSC). 0214 Ceased zigzagging. 0230 Changed course to 250(T), 250(PGC), 238(PSC). 0340 All engines ahead full, 17 1/2 knots.
0400-0800 Steaming as before, 0440 Changed course to 280(T), 280(PSG), 273(PSC). 0511 Sighted lights of Ila bearing 050(T), distance 9000 yards. 0514 Changed course to 000(T), 000(PSG), 351(PSC), changed speed to 20 knots (206 R.P.M.). 0519 Went to general quarters, 0535 Sighted Hat Island 026(T), distance 8 miles, 0538 Changed course to 035(T), 035(PSG), O28(PSC). 0551 Secured from general quarters. 0555 Commenced making preparation for entering port, standing in through submarine nets, steering various courses and speeds conforming with Channel. 0629 Moored port side to starboard U.S.S. LACKAWANNA, Preparing to receive fuel, draft forward 10'11", draft aft 14'0", 0719 Fueling completed, draft forward 12'O", draft aft 14', made preparations for getting underway. 1728 Underway in accordance with Commander Destroyer squadron TWENTY TWO 072005, Captain at conn, standing out through Hilliard channel standard speed 15 knots (155 R.P.M.).
0800-1200 Steaming as before. O801 Maneuvering to take screening position #l, U.S.S. MONTPELIER as guide, U.S.S. COLUMBIA and in column astern. 0837 Commenced zig- zagging in accordance with plan #10 on base course 260(T), 260(PGC), 251(PSC), speed 20 knots. 0856 Ceased zigzagging, resumed base course. 0857 Changed base course to 000(T), 000(PGC), 352(PSC). 0902 Went to general quarters, 0912 Commenced sled target firing - on various courses and speeds conforming to signals from Officer Tactical Command. 1050 Ceased present exercise having expended 25 rounds of 5"/38 Cal AA common - no casualties - secured from general quarters, 1105 Changed base course to 180(T), 180(PGC), 164(PSC). 1122 Commenced zigzagging in accordance with plan #10. 1131 Ceased zig-zagging resumed base course. 1132 Changed base course 330(T), 330(PGC), 308(PSC). 1144 Changed base course to 000 (T), 000(PGC), 349(PSC).
1200-1600 Steaming as before. 1255 Changed course to 180(T), 180(PGC), 164(PSC). 1350 Commenced scheduled exercise; high altitude sleeve practice. Set condition of readiness I. Set material condition afirm. 1535 Changed course to 100(T), 100(PGC). O86(PSC). 1547 Commenced zigzagging in accordance with plan #10, expended 31 rounds 5"/38 Cal. AA common projectiles, SPD2805.
1600-2000 Steaming as before. 1629 Secured from general quarters, 1730 exercise #2 completed. 1646 Ceased zigzagging, resumed base course. 1648 Changed course to 090 (T), O90(PSG), O76(PSC). 1651 Commenced zigzagging in accordance with plan #10. 1810 Ceased zigzagging. 1826 Took station 25 degrees on starboard bow of guide distance 5000 yards. Changed speed to 20 knots (206 RPM). 1840 Commenced zig zagging in accordance with plan #10.
2000-2400 Steaming as before. 2130 Changed base course to 095(T), 095(PGC), O84(PSC). Ceased zigzagging. 2000 position; latitude 17-44-00 S., Longitude 168-38-00 E.

0000-0400 Steaming in company with Task Force NINETEEN on course 095(T), 095(PGC), 082(PSC). Standard speed 15 knots, steaming at 17 knots. Screening station #3. Boilers #1 and #4 in use. 0030 Changed course to 035(T), 035(PGC) 026(PSC). 0100 Changed course to 335(T), 335(PGC), 331(PSC), Lit off boiler #2 and #3. 0130 Changed course to 300(T), 300(PGC), 294(PSC). 0235 Changed course to 310(T), 310(PGC), 304(PSC), increased speed to 22 knots to take station with U.S.S. CLEVELAND for tracking drill. 0315 Secured boilers #2 and #3.
0400-0800 Steaming as before. 0511 Exercised crew at General Quarters. 0517 Changed course to 140(T), 140(PSG), 134(PSC), changed speed to 20 knots (206 R.P.M.). 0521 Changed speed to 22 knots (228 R.P.M.), changed course to 240(T), 240(PSG), 229(PSC). 0558 Changed course to 310(T), 310(PSG), 297(PSC). 0600 secured from General Quarters. 0605 Secured from tracking drilling, took regular screening station in formation. 0617 Steadied on course 290(T), 290(PSG), 287 (PSC), speed 17 knots (177 R.P.M.). Commenced zigzagging in accordance Plan #10. Changed course to 160(T), 160(PSG), 143(PSC).
0800-1200 Steaming as before. 0830 Changed base course to 285(T), 285(PGC), 279(PSC). 0907 Changed base course 105(T), 105(PGC), 096(PSC). 0948 Commenced exercising at tactics - on various courses and speeds conforming to signals from the Officer in Tactical Command. 1035 Ceased tactical drills resuming normal screening position base course 310(T), 310(PGC), 297(PSC), speed 18 knots. 1055 Changed base course to 280(T), 280(PGS), 267(PSC). 1103 Commenced zigzagging in accordance with plan #10. 0800 Position, latitude 17-08-30 S, longitude 168-41-40 E.
1200-1600 Steaming as before. 1201 Ceased zigzagging. 1225 Commenced zigzagging in accordance with plan #l6. 1245 Changed course to 230(T), 230(PGC), 220(PSC). 1253 Changed course to 180(T), 180(T), 180(PGC), 163(PSC). 1325 Ceased zig- zagging. 1327 Changed course to 250(T), 250(PGC), 241(PSC), for aircraft launching by cruisers. 1328 Resumed base course. 1331 Commenced zigzagging in accordance with plan #10. 1337 Commenced scheduled exercise; machine gun towed sleeve practice. 1338 Decreased speed to 20 knots, 1435 Ceased present exercises. 1453 Ceased zigzagging. 1457 Changed course to 120(T), 120(PGC), 104(PSC). 1502 Decreased speed to 16 knots. 1508 Commenced zigzagging in accordance with plan #16. 1524 All engines ahead flank 25 knots, leaving formation to transfer injured man to crash boat. 1545 All engines ahead 1/3, 5 knots. 1547 Crash boat alongside to port; patient transferred. 1548 All engines ahead flank, 27 knots. Come to course 140(T), 140(PGC) to rejoin Task Force NINETEEN.
1600-2000 Steaming as before. 1637 Rejoined task force resumed screening station. steadied on base course 120(T), 120(PSG), 104(PSC), speed 20 knots (206 R.P.M.) zigzagging on plan #16. 1656 Ceased zigzagging resumed base course, steering various and speeds while cruiser picking up planes, 1710 Operations completed steadied on base course 120(T), 120(PSG) 104(PSC), speed 20 knots (206 R.P.M.). 1713 Commenced zigzagging in accordance with plan #16. 1725 Ceased zigzagging resumed base course. 1729 Changed course to 065(T), 065(PSC), 054(PSC). 1738 Commenced zigzagging in accordance with plan #10. 1812 Ceased zigzagging, changed course to 000(T), 000(PSG), 346(PSC). 1900 Commenced exercise #3 of Commander Task Force NINETEEN, underway memo no. 6-43 of June 7, 1943. 1915 Crew at general quarters, took station in column. Changed speed to 18 knots (186 R.P.M.).
2000-2400 Steaming as before. 2020 resumed screen position. 2023 Secured from general quarters. 2040 Changed course to 050(T), 050(PSG), 040(PSC). 2050 Commenced zigzagging on plan #10. 2030 Ceased zigzagging, resumed base course. 2000 Position, Latitude 17-34-00 S, longitude 168-51-45 E.

0000-0400 Steaming in company with Task Force #19 on course 050(T), 050(PGC), 040(PSC). Standard speed 15 knots, steaming at full speed, 20 knots. Screening in station #2. Boiler #1 and #4 in use. 0000 Changed course to 105(T), 105(PGC), O91(PSC). 0030 Changed course to 160(T), 160(PGC), 143(PSC). 0100 Changed course to 225 (T), 225(PGC), 212(PSC). 0230 U.S.S. COLUMBIA and U.S.S. PHILLIP left formation to take station for tracking exercise.
0400-0800 Steaming as before. 0511 Went to general quarters. 0520 Commenced exercise #5 of Commander Task Force (19) NINETEEN underway memo 6-43 of June 7, 1943, tracking drill. 0610 Secured from general quarters, set condition two, material condition baker. 0622 Exercise completed. 0645 Ceased zigzagging. 0647 Changed course to 270(T), 270(PGC), 262(PSC). 0654 Commenced zigzagging in accordance with plan #14.
0800-1200 Steaming as before. 0842 Ceased zigzagging, resumed base course. 0845 Changed base course to 330(T), 330(PGC), 326(PSC). 0907 Commenced zigzagging in accordance with plan #14. 0943 Commenced exercise in simulated dive bombing attacks and torpedo attacks. 0944 Ceased zigzagging, resumed base course. 1017 Commenced zigzagging in accordance with plan #14. 1124 Ceased present exercises. 1128 Changed base course to 000(T), 000(PGC), 356(PSC). 1145 Maneuvering on various courses and speeds to recover aircraft.
1200-1600 Steaming as before. 1203 Completed aircraft recovery. Came to course 050(T), O50(PGC), O42(PSC).
