Proceeding in accordance With Commander Task Force NINETEEN's operation order 5-43. 0033 Changed speed to 18 knots, changed course to 270(T), 270(PGC), 261(PSC). 0041 Changed speed to 14 knots, proceeding in column astern of U.S.S. PHILIP making various course and speed changes. 0146 Changed course to 210(T), 210(PGC), 202 (PSC). 0154 Task Force commenced bombardment of Japanese shore installations in Shortlands area in accordance with Commander Task Force NINETEEN's operation order 5-43. 0211 Completed bombardment. 0215 Changed speed to 30 knots - changed course to 183(T), 183(PGC), 171(PSC) - returning from area assuming station in column astern of U.S.S. PRINGLE.
0400-0800 Steaming as before. 0514 Decreased speed to 25 knots. Changed course to 112(T) 112(PGC), 106(PSC). 0611 Formed anti-aircraft maneuvering formation. 0649 Increased speed to 27 knots. 0800 Position: Latitude 08-55-00 S., Longitude 157-46-30 E.
0800-1200 Steaming as before. 0831 Changed course to 103(T), 103(PGC), 092(PSC). 1021 Changed course to 099(T), 099(PGC), 088(PSC). 1125 Secured from general quarters.
1200-1600 Steaming as before. 1345 Changed course to 110(T), 110(PSG), 098(PSC). 1351 Commenced zigzagging in accordance with plan #10. 1420 Changed course to 105(T), 105(PSG), 092(PSC). 1448 Ceased zigzagging resumed base course, steering various courses and speeds while cruisers recovered aircraft. 1540 Changed course to 110(T), 110(PSG), 098(PSC). 1200 Position: Latitude 13-15-00 S., Longitude 163-26-00 E.
1600-2000 Steaming as before. 1602 Changed speed to 24 knots. 1608 Commenced zigzagging in accordance with plan #10. 1726 Ceased zigzagging. 1732 Changed base course to 122(T), (PGC), 109 1/2 (PSC). 1735 Commenced zigzagging on plan #10. 1839 Ceased zigzagging. 1915 Changed base course to 099(T), (PGC), 086(PSC). Changed speed to 22 knots.
2000-2400 Steaming as before. 2035 Changed course to 145(T), 145(PGC), 131(PSC). 2335 Changed course to 173(T), 173(PGC), 159(PSC). 2000 Position: Latitude 09-51-00 S., Longitude 161-47-00 E.

August 1 Moored alongside USS PHILIP in San Pedro Bay, Leyte, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN in USS OCELOT).

Underway at 0806 to refuel. Completed fueling at 1123 and proceeded to Punubulu Island for ammunition. Completed taking ammunition aboard during afternoon. Moored alongside USS PHILIP at 1905.

August 2 Moored alongside USS PHILIP in San Pedro Bay, Leyte, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN in USS OCELOT).

Underway at 1355 and proceeded to Tolosa in accordance with orders of Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIX. Anchored at 1446. Underway at 1606 and moored alongside USS PHILIP at 1656.
August 3 Moored alongside USS PHILIP in San Pedro Bay, Leyte, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN in USS OCELOT).

August 4 Moored alongside USS PHILIP in San Pedro Bay, Leyte, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN in USS OCELOT).

Underway at 1025 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIX dispatch 020300 for degaussing check and magnetic compass compensation. Upon completion of compass check proceeded to Guiuan during afternoon. Anchored in Guiuan Roadstead on the southeast coast of Samar Island. Philippine Islands at 1844.

August 5 Anchored in Guiuan Harbor, southeast coast, Samar, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander MALPASS in USS ROBINSON).

Underway at 0627 in accordance with visual dispatch O41000 from Officer in Tactical Command in USS ROBINSON. Proceeded with USS PHILIP to San Pedro Bay. Entered San Pedro Bay, Leyte, Philippine Islands at 0840 and fueled during morning. Underway at 1501 from San Pedro Bay in company with USS CONY, USS PHILIP and USS ROBINSON (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander MALPASS) in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIX dispatch 050104. Proceeding to Ulithi.

August 6 Steaming en route from Leyte, Philippine Islands to Ulithi in company with USS CONY, USS PHILIP and USS ROBINSON. (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander MALPASS).

During the morning and afternoon test fired 5"/38 VT Projectiles. During the afternoon conducted surprise burst firing exercises as directed by Officer in Tactical Command.

August 7 Steaming en route from Leyte, Philippine Islands, to Ulithi in company with USS CONY, USS PHILIP and USS ROBINSON (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander MALPASS).

Entered Ulithi and at 1249 reported to Commander Marianas Group for duty in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIX dispatch 050104. Fueled during the afternoon. At 1837 moored alongside USS CONY, in Urushi Anchorage, Ulithi Island, West Caroline Islands.

August 8 Moored alongside USS CONY in Urushi Anchorage, Ulithi Island, West Caroline Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN Representative in USS PRAIRIE).

Underway from: USS CONY at 1402 and anchored at 1425 on Urushi Anchorage.

August 9 Anchored in Urushi Anchorage, Ulithi Island, West Caroline Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN Representative in USS PRAIRIE).

Underway at 1501 in accordance with Commander Task Unit NINETY FOUR POINT SIX POINT TWO dispatch 082351. Proceeding in company with USS MINNEAPOLIS to Leyte, Philippine Islands.

August 10 Steaming en route from Ulithi to Leyte Philippine Islands in company with USS MINNEAPOLIS (Officer in Tactical Command, Captain H. B. SLOCUM).

During the morning and afternoon conducted air burst firing exercises.

August 11 Steaming en route from Ulithi to Leyte, Philippine Islands in company with USS MINNEAPOLIS. (Officer in Tactical Command, Captain H. B. SLOCUM).

Detached from escort duty at 1140 and stood into San Pedro Bay, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands at 1228. Fueled during the afternoon. Anchored in San Pedro Bay at 1919.
August 12 Anchored in San Pedro Bay, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN in USS OCELOT).

August 13 Anchored in San Pedro Bay, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN in USS OCELOT).

Underway at 1826 in accordance with Commander Philippine Sea Frontier's Speed Letter 381-45 Serial 00764. Proceeding in company with USS GIANSAR (AK111) to Ulithi. Assumed screening station at 1935.
August 14 Steaming en route from Leyte, Philippine Islands to Ulithi in company with USS GIANSAR. (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander KING).
August 15 Steaming en route from Leyte, Philippine Islands to Ulithi in company with USS GIANSAR. (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander KING).
August 16 Steaming en route from Leyte, Philippine Islands to Ulithi in company with USS GIANSAR. (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander KING).

August 17 Steaming en route from Leyte, Philippine Islands to Ulithi in company with USS GIANSAR. (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander KING).

Detached from escort duty by USS GIANSAR at 1430. During the afternoon conducted sleeve firing exercises consisting of "Baker" and "George" runs, stood into Ulithi Harbor, Western Caroline Islands at 1717 and anchored at 174).

August 18 Anchored in Ulithi Harbor, Western Caroline Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN Representative in USS PRAIRIE).

Fueled during the morning. Received ammunition on board during the afternoon.
August 19-20 Anchored in Ulithi Harbor, Western Caroline Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN Representative in USS PRAIRIE).

August 21 Anchored in Ulithi Harbor, Western Caroline Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Service Squadron TEN Representative in USS PRAIRIE).

Underway at 0926 in accordance with Commander SEVENTH Fleet Secret Dispatch 180037 and Port Director Ulithi Routing Instructions as Escort for Ulithi-Leyte Convoy #87. Assumed screening station at 1040. Proceeding in company with USS GENERAL M. RANDALL (Officer in Tactical Command, Captain W. R. STEVENS), SS BRAZIL and SS SEA CORPORAL.

August 22 Steaming en route from Ulithi to Leyte, Philippine Islands in company with USS GENERAL M. RANDALL (Officer in Tactical Command, Captain W. R. STEVENS), SS BRAZIL and SS SEA CORPORAL.

During the morning fired illuminating projectiles as target for USS GENERAL M. RANDALL practice fire.

August 23 Steaming en route from Ulithi to Leyte, Philippine Islands in company with USS GENERAL M. RANDALL (Officer in Tactical Command, Captain W. R. STEVENS), SS BRAZIL and SS SEA CORPORAL.

Officer in Tactical Command dispersed convoy at 1030, Proceeded up Surigao Strait at 1103. At 1245 took departure for Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands in accordance with Port Director Homonhon's Routing Orders Serial #218 dated 23 August 1945. Steaming singly.

August 24 Steaming singly en route from Leyte Gulf, Philippine Islands to Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands.

Entered Subic Bay at 1620 and proceeded to fuel. Anchored at 1918.
August 25-28 Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY FOUR in USS ST LOUIS).
August 29 Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE in USS ST LOUIS).

August 30 Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE in USS ST LOUIS).

Assumed ready duty at 0800.

August 31 Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE in USS ST LOUIS).

Relieved of ready duty by USS WALLER at 0800.

July 1 Steaming en route from Morotai, Netherlands East Indies to Balikpapan, Borneo with ships of Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO. (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO, Rear Admiral NOBLE in USS WASATCH).

At 0553 Task Group commenced deployment for assault on Balikpapan beaches with SAUFLEY acting as one of the Screening units for transports en route to the transport area. At 0700 fire support ship's commenced pre-landing bombardment. At 0725, all units having reached the transport area, SAUFLEY took assigned station in transport area anti-submarine screen.

July 2 Steaming on patrol station in transport area anti- submarine screen off Balikpapan, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO, Rear Admiral NOBLE in USS WASATCH).

At 0731 detached from transport area screen by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN and directed to proceed to fire support station "Ruth" Southeast of Tokong Point, Balikpapan. Anchored in designated fire support area at 0824 and stood by to deliver call fire. At 1606 commenced firing on targets designated by Shore Fire Control Party. Ceased firing at 1708 having expended 60 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common and 3 rounds of White Phosphorous projectiles. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report Serial 0451 of 19 July 1945).

Underway at 1850 as directed by Commander Naval Gunfire Support and proceeded to vicinity of fire support station "Lulu" and stood by to deliver harassing illumination fire.

At 2008 commenced firing on targets designated by Shore Fire Control Party. Ceased firing at 2030 having expended 62 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report Serial 0451 of 19 July 1945). Commenced illumination fire at 2044.

July 3 Anchored on fire support station 3 miles Southeast of Tokong Point, Balikpapan, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO, Rear Admiral NOBLE in USS WASATCH). Ship delivering starshell illumination as directed by Shore Fire Control Party. Ceased firing at 0351 having expended 35 5"/38 illuminating projectiles. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report Serial 0451 of 19 July 1945).

Enemy plane reported in area at 0441 set condition of readiness I, material condition Able. At 0625 burning plane observed falling to the South. Area clear at 0720 set condition of readiness II, material condition Baker. Before being shot down by CAP unidentified plane had made several runs across beach and transport area at high altitudes. At no time did plane come within visual range of this ship.

Relieved on fire support station at 0805 by USS FLUSSER. Underway and proceeded to transport area as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN and reported to Commander Underwater Demolition Team ELEVEN for duty. Anchored in transport area at 0931 awaiting further orders, Underway at 1150 as directed by Commander Underwater Demolition Team ELEVEN and proceeded to take station off Sepinggang to cover activities of Underwater Demolition Team.

Anchored off Sepinggang at 1218. Relieved by USS WALLER at 1231 and underway and proceeded to transport area to fuel. At 1330 Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO, Rear Admiral NOBLE, shifted flag to CGC SPENCER. Upon completion of fueling at 1415 underway and proceeded to ammunition ship for replenishment. Upon completion of taking on ammunition underway and transferred mail from USS WALLER. At 1639 took patrol station in transport area screen as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN.

July 4 Steaming on patrol station in transport area anti- submarine screen off Balikpapan, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO, Rear Admiral NOBLE in CGC SPENCER).

At 0830 proceeded to fire support station "Lulu". as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN and relieved USS PHILIP. Anchored at 1041. Standing by for call fire support.

July 5 Steaming on patrol in fire support area 5 miles Southeast of Manggar, Borneo standing by for call fire missions. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO, Rear Admiral NOBLE in CGC SPENCER).

At 0400 commenced firing on targets designated by Shore Fire Control Party. Ceased firing at 0425 having expended 52 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report Serial 0451 of 19 July 1945). Unidentified aircraft reported in area during routine morning alert. Commenced firing on designated targets at 0810. Ceased firing at 0848 having expended 33 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report Serial 0451 of 19 July 1945). Relieved of fire support duty at 0924 by USS PHOENIX.

Proceeded to patrol station in transport area anti-submarine screen as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN, Arrived on station at 1403 and commenced patrolling.

Left screening station at 1635 as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN and proceeded to fire support area off Manggar airfield. Relieved USS PHILIP at 1826 and anchored 6 miles Southeast of Manggar airfield. Commenced firing on designated targets at 1830. Completed firing at 1920 having expended 14 rounds of 5"/38 White Phosphorous and 8 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report Serial 0451 of 19 July 1945).

July 6 Anchored in fire support area 6 miles Southeast of Manggar airfield, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO, Rear Admiral NOBLE in CGC SPENCER). Standing by to deliver call fire as requested by Shore Fire Control Party. At 0932 commenced firing on designated targets. Completed firing at 1351 having expended 510 rounds of AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report Serial 0451 of 19 July 1945). At 1406 shifted anchorage 2000 yards nearer to beach. Commenced firing on designated targets at 1919. Completed firing at 1937 having expended 48 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report Serial 0451 of 19 July 1945).

July 7 Anchored in fire support area 5 miles Southeast of Manggar airfield, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO, Rear Admiral NOBLE in CGC SPENCER). Standing by to deliver call fire as requested by Shore Fire Control Party.

At 0027 commenced delivering illumination fire. Ceased illumination at 0114. At 0123 commenced harassing fire as directed by Shore Fire Control Party. Completed firing at 0134 having expended 44 rounds of 5"/38 Illuminating projectiles and 48 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report Serial 0451 of 19 July 1945). Commenced firing on designated targets at 0600. Completed firing at 0605 having expended 50 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report of 19 July 1945). Relieved of fire support duties at 0716 by USS PHILIP. Underway at 0736 and took station in transport area anti-submarine screen as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN.

At 0923 left screen and proceeded into transport area to take on ammunition as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN. Upon completion directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN to proceed to radar picket station #2. At 1330 Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN directed SAUFLEY to return from station and proceed to Manggar fire support area. Anchored 5 miles Southeast of Manggar airfield at 1452. Relieved USS CHARRETTE of fire support duty. Standing by awaiting further orders.

Commenced firing on designated targets at 1527. Completed firing at 1619 having expended 62 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. At 1750 commenced firing on new targets. Completed firing at 1759 having expended 57 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. (See SAUFLEY action report Serial 0451 of 19 July).

At 1900 Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO, Rear Admiral NOBLE in CGC SPENCER departed this area. Captain GRAY, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN in USS KEY assumed duties as SOPA this area.

Underway at 1914 as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN and proceeded to assigned station in transport area anti-submarine screen. On Station at 1945 and commenced patrolling.

July 8 Steaming on patrol station in transport area anti-submarine screen off Balikpapan, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN, Captain GRAY in USS KEY).

During the morning proceeded into transport area and fueled. Upon completion of fueling, rejoined screen.

July 9 Steaming on patrol station in transport area anti-submarine screen off Balikpapan. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN, Captain GRAY in USS KEY).

During the morning proceeded into transport area and fueled. Upon completion of fueling rejoined the screen.

July 10 Steaming on patrol station in transport area anti-submarine screen off Balikpapan, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN, Captain GRAY in USS KEY).

At 0730 directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN to proceed to fire support station "Ruth". At O840 anchored on fire support station Southeast of Tokong Point, Balikpapan. Underway at 1711 and took station in transport area screen relieving USS PHILIP. At 1830 observed a large explosion close aboard stern of LCI(G) 66 patrolling inshore. Proceeded to close in order to render assistance as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN. Damaged LCI reported he did not need our assistance as another LCI had closed to assist him. Returned to station at 1920.

At 2028 made sound contact in Northern half of patrol station. Maneuvered to develop attack and between 2033 and 2135 made five depth charge attacks. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 0443 of 11 July 1945). At 2142 USS THOMAS exchanged stations with this ship and continued to develop contact.
July 11 Steaming on patrol station in transport area anti-submarine screen off Balikpapan, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN, Captain GRAY in USS KEY).

July 12 Steaming on patrol station in transport area anti-submarine screen off Balikpapan, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN, Captain GRAY in USS KEY).

During the morning proceeded into the transport area and fueled. After fueling anchored 4½ miles southeast of Point Tokong as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN.

Underway at 1218 and rejoined screen at 1256 in accordance with orders of Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN.
<div>July 1 Steaming on patrol station in transport area anti-submarine screen off Balikpapan, Borneo. (SOPA, Captain GRAY in USS KEY).

July 14 Steaming on patrol station in transport area anti-submarine screen off Balikpapan, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN, Captain GRAY in USS KEY). At 0642 departed station and proceeded to fire support station off Manggar as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TWO POINT FIFTEEN. Anchored on fire support station at 0725 and stood by awaiting firing orders.
July 15 & 16 Anchored 3¼ miles East Of Manggar River in fire support area awaiting firing instructions. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN, Captain GRAY in USS KEY).

July 17 Anchored 3¼ miles East of Manggar River in fire Support area awaiting firing instructions. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN, Captain Gray in USS KEY).

Underway at 0740 as directed by screen commander and proceeded into transport area to fuel. Upon completion of fueling anchored 3 miles South of Sepinggang as directed by screen commander. At 1300 Captain MEE in LST 732 relieved Captain GRAY as Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN and duties of Senior Officer Present Afloat.
July 18 Anchored 3 miles South of Sepinggang, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN, Captain MEE in LST 732).

July 19 Anchored 3 miles South of Sepinggang, Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN, Captain MEE in LST 732). Underway at 1730 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIXTEEN dispatch 190515. At 1818 formed up with USS CHEPATCHET and USS PHILIP (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander RUTTER) and departed Balikpapan, Borneo for Morotai, Netherlands East Indies.
July 20 Steaming en route from Balikpapan, Borneo to Morotai, Netherlands East Indies, in company with USS CHEPATCHET and USS PHILIP (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander RUTTER).

July 21 Steaming en route from Balikpapan, Borneo to Morotai, Netherlands East Indies, in company with USS CHEPATCHET and USS PHILIP (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander RUTTER). At 1402 USS CHEPATCHET detached and proceeded in accordance with Commander Service Force SEVENTH Fleet's dispatch 191315.

July 22 Steaming en route from Balikpapan, Borneo to Morotai, Netherlands East Indies, in company with USS PHILIP (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander RUTTER). During the morning entered Morotai, fueled, and anchored at 0923. Reported to Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT THIRTEEN for duty.
July 23 Anchored in Morotai, Netherlands East Indies. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT THIRTEEN in Lot 780).

July 24 Anchored in Morotai, Netherlands East Indies, (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT THIRTEEN in LOT 780). Underway at 1456 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT THIRTEEN dispatch 220285. At 1543 formed Task Unit SEVENTY SIX POINT THIRTEEN POINT TWENTY TWO with USS PHILIP (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander RUTTER) and departed Morotai, Netherlands East Indies for Leyte, Philippine Islands.

July 25 Steaming en route from Morotai, Netherlands East Indies to Leyte, Philippine Islands in company with USS PHILIP (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander RUTTER) as Task Unit SEVENTY SIX POINT THIRTEEN POINT TWENTY TWO.

July 26 Steaming en route from Morotai, Netherlands East Indies to Leyte, Philippine Islands in company with USS PHILIP (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander RUTTER) as Task Unit SEVENTY SIX POINT THIRTEEN POINT TWENTY TWO.

During the morning conducted sleeve firing exercises consisting of Baker and George runs. USS JOBB participated in these exercises.

Entered Leyte Gulf at 1200 and proceeded up Gulf to San Pedro Bay at 1350 and anchored off Tolosa at 1428. Reported to Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIX for duty. Underway at 1650 as directed by Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIX and proceeded to anchorage area off Samar. Moored port side to USS PHILIP at 1817.
July 27-31 Moored alongside USS PHILIP in San Pedro Bay, Leyte, Philippine Islands. Emergency repairs being accomplished by USS DIXIE. (SOPA, Commander Service Squadron TEN in USS OCELOT).

0000-0400 Moored to port side USS CLEVELAND, berth #13, Segond Channel, Espiritu Santo, New Hebrides. Boiler #3 steaming for auxiliaries.
0400-0800 Moored as before. 0415 Lighted off #1 boiler. 0500 Commenced preparations for getting underway. 0548 Underway following various courses at various speeds to berth #24. 0606 Anchored in berth #24, in 27 fathoms of water with 75 fathoms of chain to port anchor. 0645 Died out fires under #1 boiler, #3 boiler in use for auxiliary purposes. 0745 USS RENSHAW moored alongside to starboard.
0800-1200 Anchored as before.
1200-1600 Anchored as before.
1600-2000 Anchored as before.
2000-2400 Anchored as before.

0000-0400 Anchored in berth #24, Segond Channel, Espiritu Santo, New Hebrides, in 27 fathoms of water, 75 fathoms of chain to port anchor. Boiler #3 in use for auxiliary purposes. USS RENSHAW moored starboard side to our port.
0400-0800 Anchored as before.
0800-1200 Anchored as before. 1045 Made all preparations for getting underway. 1147 Underway in accordance with Commander Task Group THIRTY SIX POINT TWO mailgrem 310300. Captain at the conn, executive officer and navigator on the bridge, on various courses and speeds conforming to Segond Channel, Espiritu Santo.
1200-1600 Steaming as before. 1220 Commenced sortie. 1247 Cruiser Division TWELVE standing out of channel, formed screen, took station #2. Steadied on 090(T), 090(PSG), 079 (PSC), speed 20 knots (201 RPM). 1258 Change course to 135(T), 135(PSG), 126 (PSC). 1304 Changed course to 180(T), 180(PSG), 170(PSC). 1316 Commenced zig- zagging in accordance with plan #10. 1334 Changed course to 235(T), 235(PSG), 226 1/2(PSC). 1349 Changed course to 270(T), 270(PSG), 261 1/2(PSC). 1427 Changed course to 255(T), 255(PSG), 246 1/2(PSC). 1431 Commenced scheduled exercises, baker runs A.A. firing. 1437 Commenced zigzagging in accordance with plan #10. 1500 Crew called to general quarters. 1535 Ceased zigzagging resumed base course. Changed speed to 19 knots (190 RPM). 1540 Secured from general quarters set condition II, material condition baker. 1558 Commenced zigzagging in accordance with plan #14.
1600-2000 Steaming as before. 1750 Ceased zigzagging. 1800 Changed base course to 272(T), (PGC), 262(PSC). 1810 Commenced zigzagging on plan #14. 1828 Ceased zigzagging.
2000-2400 Steaming as before. 2000 Position: Latitude 16-10-00 S., Longitude 165-25-00 E.

0000-0400 Steaming in company with Task Force THIRTY SIX POINT TWO, on base course 272(T), (PGC), 262(PSC). Standard speed 15 knots, steaming at full speed, 19 knots. Sereening station #2 with cruisers in cruising formation #2. Boilers #1 and #3 in use.
0400-0800 Steaming as before. 0430 Contacted Task Unit THIRTY SIX POINT THREE POINT TWO, bearing 338(T), distance 15 miles. 0530 Contacted Task Unit THIRTY SIX POINT THREE POINT ONE bearing 234(T), distance 19 miles. 0536 Crew called to general quarters, exercised at damage control problem. 0550 Commenced zigzagging accordance with Plan #14. 0624 Ceased zigzaggzing resumed base course. Steering various courses and speeds forming screen in formation 5—LS. 0659 Secured from general quarters, set condition II, material condition baker. 0705 Steadied on fleet course 350(T), 350(PSG), 340 1/2(PSC), fleet axis 210(T), speed 15 knots (146 RPM). 0721 Changed fleet speed to 17.5 knots (175 RPM). 0755 Changed course to 150(T), 150(PSG), 139(PSC), while carrier launched planes.
0800-1200 Steaming as before. 0820 Completed aircraft operations. Returned to base course. 0835 Changed course to 150(T), for aircraft operations. 0850 Completed aircraft operations. Returned to base course. 0906 Commenced zigzagging on plan #6. 0934 Changed course to 225(T), (PGC), 215(PSC). 0935 Set condition I. Took station for air attack screen. 1013 Changed course to 180(T), (PGC), 174(PSC). 1016 Set condition II. Resumed normal screening station. 1115 Resumed base course, 1158 Changed Fleet axis to 190(T). 0800 Position: Latitude 15-56-00 S., Longitude 161-56-00 E.

February 1, 1943
Proceeding in company with Task Force ELEVEN. Task Force ELEVEN consisting of USS SARATOGA (Commander Task Force ELEVEN - Rear Admiral D. C. Ramsey), USS SAN JUAN, USS SAUFLEY (Commander Destroyer Squadron SIX), USS CASE, USS MAURY, and USS MCCALL. On course and axis 015 (T), speed 20 knots in special cruising disposition 11. Operating in accordance with Commander South Pacific's Operation Order 4-43.
  • 0100 Changed front to 140 (T).
  • 0632 Sunrise.
  • 0830 U.S.S. CIMARRON and U.S.S. GRIDLEY joined formation.
  • 0900 Task Force commenced fueling operation, fueling course 135 (T), speed 10 knots.
  • 1116 Sighted Task Force SIXTY-FOUR, WASHINGTON, INDIANA, NORTH CAROLINA, and three destroyers, bearing 316 (T), distance 26,000 yards.

1 December 1942
(A) Part of Task Force Unit 66.6. U.S.S. INDIANA, U.S.S. COLUMBIA, U.S.S. DEHAVEN, U.S.S. SAUFLEY. Captain A. S. MERRILL, U.S.N., in U.S.S. INDIANA, commanding.
(B) Operation Order #3-42, Signed by Captain MERRILL
(D) En route from Tongatabu to Noumea, New Caledonia, in company with above mentioned ships.

2 December 1942
(A) Part of Task Force Unit 66.6, U.S.S. INDIANA, U.S.S. COLUMBIA, U.S.S. DEHAVEN, U.S.S SAUFLEY. Captain A. S. MERRILL, U.S.N., in U.S.S. INDIANA, commanding.
(B) Operation Order #3-42, Signed by Captain MERRILL
(D) Arrived Noumea Bay, New Caledonia. Afternoon reported with U.S.S. COLUMBIA and U.S.S. DEHAVEN to COMSOPAC.

3 December 1942
Moored in Noumea Bay, New Caledonia.

4 December 1942
Moored in Noumea Bay, New Caledonia.

5 December 1942
(A) Part of Task Unit 62.4.8 Transports PRESIDENT JACKSON, PRESIDENT ADAMS, CRESCENT CITY, MERCURY and Destroyers U.S.S. GRAYSON, U.S.S. NICHOLAS, U.S.S. SAUFLEY and U.S.S. DEHAVEN. Captain I.N. KILAND, U.S.N. Commanding. Task Unit is part of Task Force 62 South Pacific Fleet.
Operation Order 3-42 dated 4 December 1942. Signed by Captain KILAND.
(D) En route with above named vessels, from Noumea Bay, New Caledonia, to Lunga Point, Guadalcanal.

6 December 1942
(A) Part of Task Unit 62.4.8. as before. U.S.S. HOPKINS joined escort.
(B) Operation order 3.42 dated 4 December 1942.
(C) *1200 Course made good last twenty four (24) hours. 333 (T); distance 315 miles.
(D) En route as before from Noumea Bay, New Caledonia to Lunga Point, Guadalcanal.

7 December 1942
(A) Part of Task Unit 62.4.8 as before.
(B) Operation order 3.42 dated 4 December 1942.
(C) *1200 Course made good last twenty four (24) hours. 003½ (T); distance 310 miles.
(D) En route as before from Noumea Bay, New Caledonia to Lunga Point, Guadalcanal.

8 December 1942

Arrived Lunga Point, Guadalcanal. Transports proceeded to disembark troops and unload supplies. Task Unit retired eastward to sea for the night in accordance with secret mailgram 080245.

9 December 1942

Part of Task Unit 62.4.8. Continued unloading of transports, at Guadalcanal. Retired to Tulagi Bay for night. Patrolled outside harbor.

10 December 1942

Formed Task Force Unit 62.4.3 in accordance with Task Force Commander's dispatch 092212. USS DEHAVEN, USS SAUFLEY and USS MERCURY comprising. Lt. Comdr. Tolman, of the USS DEHAVEN commanding.

Continued unloading of Mercury at Guadalcanal. Retired to Tulagi Bay for night.

11 December 1942

Part of Task Force Unit 62.4.3 As before, screening the U.S.S. MERCURY at Lunga Point. Retired to Tulagi Bay for the night.

12 December 1942

While alongside U.S.S. MERCURY in Tulagi Harbor as part of Task Force 62.4.3 at about 0400 Love received orders from the U.S.S. DEHAVEN, to proceed in company, to west and northward of Savo to search for a Japanese destroyer reported burning as a result of a night encounter with out P T boats. In clearing the U.S.S. MERCURY, her cargo boom fouled the U.S.S. SAUFLEY starboard yard arm and carried away all radio transmitting antennae except the TBS. While proceeding at thirty (30) knots received radio report from planes that there were a number of Japanese landing boats along the shore about two (2) miles west of Cape Esperance, THE U.S.S. DEHAVEN detailed the U.S.S. SAUFLEY to investigate those boats and continued to the northwestward to search for the destroyer.

The U.S.S. SAUFLEY requested location of own PT boats from Tulagi (via the U.S.S. DEHAVEN due to lack of transmitter), Received word that there were two (2) still out in the area. After accounting for those two (2), sighted other unidentified boats underway offshore about two (2) miles west of Esperance. Requested U.S.S. DEHAVEN to again check location of our own PT boats and stated that the USS SAUFLEY was going to open fire on boats sighted. Received no further information on own boats and opened fire at about 12000 yards to prevent boats from reaching shore. After five salvos received word that another U.S. PT boat had reported being fired upon. Ceased fire. Did not observe any direct hits on PT boats and believe no damage done. Continued cruising offshore in the vicinity. Amplifying reports received indicating that one previously unaccounted for PT boat was aground and other PT boats were proceeding in to assist, taking off boat or crew as feasible.

During the above period operations were seriously hampered by fact that PT boats and planes were on the same frequency. Testing and tuning of plane transmitters interfered with operational orders and reports between PT boats, the U.S.S. DEHAVEN, U.S.S. SAUFLEY and Tulagi.

The U.S.S. DEHAVEN made no contact, and after receiving plane report that no Japanese ships were in the vicinity returned to the vicinity of Cape Esperance and directed the U.S.S. SAUFLEY report to Commander Task Group 66.7.1 in U.S.S. MINNEAPOLIS, Captain C.E. ROSENDAHL, Commanding, at Tulagi, for further instructions.

Returned, searched area west and south of Savo for survivors of lost PT boat. Found wreckage of PT boat which apparently had caught fire and then blown up. No survivors were found.

13 December 1942

Part of Task Unit 66.7.1. As before in accordance with operation order of 12 December 1942, signed by Captain C. E. ROSENDAHL, Commanding U.S.S. MINNEAPOLIS. Proceeding from Tulagi Bay to Espiritu Santos escorting U.S.S. MINNEAPOLIS in company with U.S.S. MEADE and U.S.S. NAVAJO.

About 1925 made sound contact, range 900 yards, bearing 300 (T). Made deliberate attack and at 1932 dropped seven charges pattern firing time from recorder. Continued to search area. 2044 sighted small oil slick, weak echoes and fired three charges. Continued to search area until 2142 at which time rejoined convoy.

14 December 1942

Part of Task Unit 66.7.1. As before. Screening operations en route to Espiritu Santos from Tulagi Bay.

Submarine contact at 1540 bearing 185 (T) at 1100 yards. Own ship course 160, speed 12 knots. Came right for deliberate attack. Increased speed to 15 knots. 1542 fired first charge of a nine charge medium pattern. Searched area for one hour 23 minutes and unable to pick up further contact.

15 December 1942

Part of Task Unit 66.4.7.1. As before. Screening escorts to Espiritu Santos from Tulagi Bay.

16 December 1942

Part of Task Unit 66.4.7.1. As before. Screening operations en route Espiritu Santos from Tulagi Bay.

Arrived Espiritu Santos late afternoon. Detached from Task Unit 66.7.1.

17 December 1942

Moored alongside U.S.S. ZANE and U.S.S. TREVOR. Underway at 1030 Love. Part of Task Group 67. Cruisers U.S.S. LOUISVILLE and U.S.S. HELENA, Task Unit 67.2.1. U.S.S. HONOLULU and U.S.S. COLUMBIA Task Unit 67.2.2. Rear Admiral in the U.S.S. HONOLULU Commanding. Escorting destroyers, U.S.S. FLETCHER, U.S.S. DAYTON, U.5.5. LANG, U.S.S. SAUFLEY. Captain Briscoe in the U.S.S. FLETCHER Commanding.

Operating in accordance with Rear Admiral W.L. Ainsworth's operation order 2-42 of 17 December 1942 and operation dispatch 160352 from COMSOPAC.

0800 Moored at Espiritu Santos

18 December 1942

Part of Task Group 67 as before. Screening cruisers and patrolling area indicated by positions shown below.

19 December 1942

Part of Task Group 67 as before. Screening cruisers in area indicated by positions listed below.

20 December 1942

Part of Task Group 67 as before - Screening cruisers and patrolling area indicated by positions shown below.

21 December 1942

Part of Task Group 67 as before - Screening cruisers and patrolling area indicated by positions shown below.

22 December 1942

Part of Task Group 67 as before - Screening cruisers and patrolling area indicated by positions shown below.

2000 Moored at Espiritu Santos

23 December 1942

Moored at Espiritu Santos Bay.

24 December 1942

Part of Task Group 67 - Patrolling area outside Espiritu Santos Bay in accordance with Task Affirm of Harbor Defense Plan #2.

25 December 1942

Patrolling as before - Relieved at 1200 Love and returned to mooring at Espiritu Santos Bay.

26 December 1942

Moored at Espiritu Santos Bay.

27 December 1942

Underway at 0600 Love in company with the USS LANG to rendezvous with Task Unit 62.4.3. Joined Task Unit en route to Guadalcanal, composed of transports USS REPUBLIC, USS PRESIDENT GRANT, and USAT WILLARD A HOLBROOK and escorting destroyers REID, CUMMINGS, CASE. Commander Task Unit in REPUBLIC - Captain T. G. Peyton.

Operating under operational plan #1-42 dated 19 December 1942 signed by Captain Peyton.

28 December 1942

Part of Task Unit 62-43 as before en route to Guadalcanal, Escorting and screening transports.

1200 Course made good last twenty-four hours 290 distance 218 miles.

29 December 1942

Part of Task Unit 62.4.3 as before en route to Guadalcanal. Escorting and screening transports.

1200 Course made good last 24 hours 305 (T) Distance 218 miles.

30 December 1942

Part of Task Unit 62.4.3 as before, Arrived off Lunga Point, Guadalcanal Island. Screened unloading operations of transports. Retired eastward through Lunga Channel for patrol duty during night.

31 December 1942

Part of Task Unit 62.4.3 as before. Screening unloading operations of transports. Task Unit retired to Tulagi Harbor for night.
November 1-4 Moored alongside USS DIXIE in Whangpoo River, Shanghai, China. Emergency repairs being accomplished by USS DIXIE. (Senior Officer Present Afloat Rear Admiral JOY in USS NASHVILLE.)

November 5 Moored alongside USS DIXIE in Whangpoo River, Shanghai, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat Rear Admiral JOY in USS NASHVILLE.)

Conducted dock trial during the morning. Underway at 1140 in accordance with Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE dispatch 040445. Proceeded down stream to Yangtze entrance buoy. Anchored at 1615 in South Channel of Yangtze River. At 1900 relieved USS CONY as Harbor Entrance Control Vessel.
November 6-10 Anchored in South Channel of Yangtze River, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat Lieutenant Commander SILK in USS SAUFLEY.)

November 11 Anchored in South Channel of Yangtze River, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat Lieutenant Commander SILK in USS SAUFLEY.)

Relieved as Harbor Entrance Control Vessel by USS WALLER at 0931. Underway for Shanghai at 1001 in accordance with Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE dispatch 101213. At 1435 moored to USS ORVETTA in the Whangpoo River, Shanghai, China.

November 12 Moored alongside USS ORVETTA in Whangpoo River, Shanghai, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat Rear Admiral JOY, Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE, in USS NASHVILLE.)

Underway from alongside USS ORVETTA at 0525 in accordance with Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE dispatch 101213 of November 1945. Proceeding to Okinawa Gunto. Took station in the Yangtze River as escort for USS HOCKING.

November 13 Steaming en route from Shanghai, China to Okinawa Gunto, escorting USS HOCKING. (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander C.D. SCHUTZ, USNR, in USS HOCKING.)

During the morning test fired 5"/38 VT projectiles. Detached from USS HOCKING at 1905. Proceeding independently to Okinawa Gunto.

November 14 Steaming singly en route from Shanghai, China to Okinawa Gunto.

Entered Buckner Bay, Okinawa Shima, Nansei Shoto and anchored at 0742.

November 15 Anchored in Buckner Bay, Okinawa Shima, Nansei Shoto.

Underway at 1000 in accordance with Commander Task Force SEVENTY THREE dispatch 101213 of November 1945. Proceeding to Shanghai, China.

November 16 Steaming singly en route from Okinawa Gunto to Shanghai, China.

Entered Whangpoo River at 0848. Moored to USS ORVETTA at 1015.
November 17-18 Moored to USS ORVETTA in the Whangpoo River, Shanghai, China. Emergency repairs being accomplished by USS SIERRA. (Senior Officer Present Afloat Rear Admiral JOY in USS SAINT PAUL.)

November 19 Moored to USS ORVETTA in the Whangpoo River, Shanghai, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat Rear Admiral Joy in USS SAINT PAUL.)

Underway from alongside USS ORVETTA at 0840 in accordance with verbal orders from Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO. Anchored at 1213 in South Channel of Yangtze River. Assumed Harbor Entrance Control Vessel duty from USS WALLER at 1245.
November 20-25 Anchored in South Channel of Yangtze River, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat Lieutenant Commander SILK, in USS SAUFLEY.)

November 26 Anchored in South Channel of Yangtze River, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat Lieutenant Commander SILK, USN, in USS SAUFLEY.)

Underway at 0911 for Tungsha Banks to transfer pilots. Anchored at 1145 in vicinity of Yangtze Entrance Buoy.

November 27 Anchored in South Channel of Yangtze River, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat Lieutenant Commander SILK, USN, in USS SAUFLEY.)

Relieved as Harbor Entrance Control Vessel by USS PHILIP at 1330. Underway at 1334 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO dispatch 260046, proceeding to Shanghai, China. Moored to USS ROBINSON at 1735 in the Whangpoo River, Shanghai, China.
November 28-30 Moored to USS ROBINSON in the Whangpoo River, Shanghai, China. (Senior Officer Present Afloat Rear Admiral JOY in USS SAINT PAUL.)

May 1. Anchored in Tawi Tawi Bay, Tawi Tawi Island, Sulu Archipelago, Philippine Islands. (SOPA Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO in USS POCOMOKE). At 1540 underway in accordance with Commander Seventh Amphibious Force secret dis- patch 30013 of 30 April 1945, in company with units of Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN, consisting of 7 YMSs and 1 LCS, (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander NEVILLE in USS SAUFLEY). Departed Tawi Tawi, Sulu Archipelago, for Zamboanga, Mindanao, Philippine Islands.

Steaming en route from Tawi Tawi, Sulu Archipelago, to Zamboanga, Mindanao, Philippine Islands, with units of Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN consisting of 7 YMSs and 1 LCS, (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander NEVILLE in USS SAUFLEY). 0945 Exercised 40 MM gun crews at burst practice. Departed from Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN pursuant to verbal orders Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN. Arrived Zamboanga 1123 and anchored in Santa Cruz Bank, Basilan Strait, Philippine Islands, at 1150.

May 3. Anchored on Santa Cruz Bank, Basilan Strait, Philippine Islands. (SOPA in USS STONEWALL). 1644 In accordance with Commander Seventh Amphibious Force dispatch 30031, Commander NEVILLE, Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN, transferred flag to LCS 766. 1802 Underway in accordance with Commander Seventh Amphibious Force dispatch 30031. Departed from Zamboanga, Mindanao, Philippine Islands, for Leyte Island, Philippine Islands.

May 4. Steaming en route from Zamboanga, Mindanao Island, Philippine Islands, to Leyte Gulf, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands. 1414 Entered Leyte Gulf. Anchored in San Pedro Bay at 1739. (SOPA Rear Admiral GLOVER, Commander Service Force SEVENTH Fleet, at Tolosa, Leyte Island).

May 5. Anchored in San Pedro Bay, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands. (SOPA Rear Admiral GLOVER, Commander Service Force SEVENTH Fleet, at Tolosa, Leyte Island). 0713 Went alongside USS WHITNEY for repairs.

May 6. Moored alongside USS WHITNEY in San Pedro Bay, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands. (SOPA Rear Admiral GLOVER, Commander Service Force SEVENTH Fleet, at Tolosa, Leyte Island). Underway during the afternoon to fuel. 1839 Anchored in San Pedro Bay, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands.

May 7. Anchored in San Pedro Bay, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands. (SOPA Rear Admiral GLOVER, Commander Service Force SEVENTH Fleet, at Tolosa, Leyte Island). 0557 Underway en route from San Pedro Bay, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands, to Morotai Island, Dutch East Indies, in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT SIX secret dispatch 040156 of May 1945. Formed up Task Unit SEVENTY SIX POINT Six POINT FOUR consisting of USS DAY (Officer in Tactical Command), USS SAUFLEY, 5 AMSs and 2 YMSs.

May 8. Steaming en route from San Pedro Bay, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands, to Morotai Island, Dutch East Indies, in company with Task Unit SEVENTY SIX POINT SIX POINT FOUR consisting of USS DAY (Officer in Tactical Command), USS SAUFLEY, 5 AMSs and 2 YMSs.

May 9. Steaming en route from San Pedro Bay, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands, to Morotai Island, Dutch East Indies, in company with Task Unit SEVENTY SIX POINT SIX POINT FOUR consisting of USS DAY (Officer in Tactical Command), USS SAUFLEY, 5 AMSs and 2 YMSs. 1559 Entering Morotai anchorage, Morotai Island, Dutch East Indies. 1657 Anchored in Morotai anchorage, Morotai Island. (SOPA Rear Admiral ROYAL in USS ROCKY MOUNT).
May 10-14 Anchored in Morotai Harbor, Morotai Island, Dutch East Indies. (SOPA Rear Admiral ROYAL in USS ROCKY MOUNT).

May 15 Anchored in Morotai Harbor, Morotai Island, Dutch East Indies. (SOPA Rear Admiral ROYAL in USS ROCKY MOUNT). 1330 Entered ARD 12, drydock, for hull inspection relative to hull structural damage of USS SAUFLEY incurred on 29 November 1944. 1732 Re-floated and returned to anchorage in Morotai Harbor, Morotai Island. Hull inspection party (Commander W.N. PRICE, USN) found no serious hull damage sufficient to require docking repairs.
May 16 Anchored in Morotai Harbor, Morotai Island, Dutch East Indies. (SOPA Rear Admiral ROYAL in USS ROCKY MOUNT).

May 17 Anchored in Morotai Harbor, Morotai Island, Dutch East Indies. (SOPA Rear Admiral ROYAL in USS ROCKY MOUNT). 0630 Underway in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT THIRTEEN dispatch 160446 of May 1945. Formed up with convoy consisting of USS BRANNON, 6 LSTs and the SS CHARLES LOOMIS. (Officer in Tactical Command in LST 595). Departed from Morotai Island, Dutch East Indies, for San Pedro Bay, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands. At 1156 developed sound contact. 1222 Dropped a nine charge medium pattern with no results. 1241 Contact non-sub; rejoined formation in accordance with screen commander's verbal orders.

May 18 Steaming en route from Morotai Island, Dutch East Indies, to San Pedro Bay, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands, in company with USS BRANNON, 6 LSTs and the SS CHARLES LOOMIS. (Officer in Tactical Command in LST 595). 1841 Developed sound contact. 1849 Sound contact evaluated as non-submarine; rejoined formation.

May 19 Steaming en route from Morotai Island, Dutch East Indies, to San Pedro Bay, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands, in company with USS BRANNON, 6 LSTs and the SS CHARLES LOOMIS. (Officer in Tactical Command in LST 595). 1710 USS BRANNON developed sound contact. At 1714 the contact was evaluated as non-submarine. USS BRANNON rejoined formation. In accordance with Screen Commander's dispatch 190804 left convoy and proceeded into Surigao Straits to report on shipping traffic in straits for convoy.

May 20 Steaming en route from Morotai Island, Dutch East Indies, to San Pedro Bay, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands, in company with USS BRANNON, 6 LSTs and the SS CHARLES LOOMIS. (Officer in Tactical Command in LST 595). SAUFLEY patrolling well ahead of convoy to report shipping traffic. Rejoined convoy at 0153 and resumed normal screening station. 0615 Detached from convoy by visual orders of the Screen Commander and proceeded into San Pedro Bay to fuel. Upon completion of fueling, moored alongside USS WHITNEY in San Pedro Bay for hull structural repairs. (SOPA, (Administrative) Commander Task Unit SEVENTY TWO POINT SEVEN POINT ONE in USS OTUS).
May 21-28 Moored alongside USS WHITNEY in San Pedro Bay, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands. (SOPA, (Administrative) Commander Task Unit SEVENTY TWO POINT SEVEN POINT ONE in USS OTUS).

May 29 Moored alongside USS WHITNEY in San Pedro Bay, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands. (SOPA, (Administrative) Commander Task Unit SEVENTY TWO POINT SEVEN POINT ONE in USS OTUS). 1330 Underway from alongside USS WHITNEY; proceeded to join USS PHILIP on firing range in Leyte Gulf, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands, for anti-aircraft practice. Completed anti-aircraft practice at 1706 and set course for Morotai Island, Dutch East Indies, in company with USS PHILIP (Officer in Tactical Command) in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE dispatch 270053.

May 30 Steaming en route from San Pedro Bay, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands, to Morotai Island, Dutch East Indies, in company with USS PHILIP (Officer in Tactical Command). Fired off- set practice with USS PHILIP in the morning.

May 31 Steaming en route from San Pedro Bay, Leyte Island, Philippine Islands, to Morotai island, Dutch Hast Indies, in company with USS PHILIP (Officer in Tactical Command). Fired anti-aircraft practice against towed sleeve in the morning. 1215 Entered Morotai Anchorage, fueled ship and moored alongside USS PHILIP at 1543. (SOPA Rear Admiral ROYAL in USS ROCKY MOUNT).

April 1. Steaming in company with ships of Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN (Officer in Tactical Command - Captain MURPHY in U.S.S. SAUFLEY) en route from Zamboanga, Mindanao, to Sanga Sanga, Sulu Archipelago.

April 2. Steaming in company with ships of Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN (Officer in Tactical Command - Captain MURPHY in U.S.S. SAUFLEY) en route from Zamboanga, Mindanao, to Sanga Sanga, Sulu Archipelago. At 0630 arrived off West coast of Sanga Sanga and commenced landing operations beginning with mine sweep off landing beach. The first wave of troops landed at approximately 0800. SAUFLEY patrolled to Westward of transport area during landing operations.

At 1350 transport area received several bursts of what appeared to be 40M/M from Sanga Sanga Island. Slight damage to several landing craft. No casualties.

At 1800 Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN POINT TWO (Captain SMITH in U.S.S. WALLER) departed for Zamboanga escorting first retirement group. During the night U.S.S. SAUFLEY and U.S.S. PHILIP screened 4 YMSs, and 2 LCSs during night retirement to the Southward into Celebes Sea.

April 3. Steaming on night retirement from Sanga Sanga Island, Sulu Archipelago. U.S.S. SAUFLEY (Officer in Tactical Command - Captain MURPHY - Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN) and U.S.S. PHILIP screening 4 YMSs and 2 LCSs. Returned to transport area at 0830 and SAUFLEY commenced patrolling to seaward.

During the morning YMS 71 hit mine and sunk while conducting sweeping operations in Western entrance to Tawi Tawi Bay.

At night U.S.S. SAUFLEY (Officer in Tactical Command - Captain MURPHY - Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN) and U.S.S. PHILIP screened retirement of 3 YMSs, 2 LSMs, 2 LCSs and 1 LST to the Southward into Celebes Sea.

April 4. Steaming on night retirement from Sanga Sanga, Sulu Archipelago. U.S.S. SAUFLEY (Officer in Tactical Command - Captain MURPHY - Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN) and U.S.S. PHILIP screening 3 YMSs, 2 LSMs, 2 LCSs and 1 LST, Returned to transport area at 0700 and commenced patrolling to Westward of transport area.

Departed Sanga Sanga at 1600 for Zamboanga with U.S.S. SAUFLEY and U.S.S. PHILIP screening 2 LSMs, 1 LST and 1 LCS.

April 5. Steaming en route from Sanga Sanga, Sulu Archipelago to Zamboanga, Mindanao, in company with elements of Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN (Officer in Tactical Command - Captain MURPHY in U.S.S. SAUFLEY). At 0030 3 YMSs and l LCS joined the formation. At 1130 in accordance with verbal orders of Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN departed from the formation and proceeded to Zamboanga. Arrived Zamboanga in late afternoon and anchored on Santa Cruz Bank at 1850.
April 6. Anchored on Santa Cruz Bank, Basilan Strait, Mindanao, P.I. (Senior Officer Present Afloat in U.S.S. SAUFLEY).
April 7. Anchored on Santa Cruz Bank, Basilan Strait, Mindanao, P.I. (Senior Officer Present Afloat in U.S.S. SAUFLEY).

April 8. Anchored on Santa Cruz Bank, Basilan Strait, Mindanao, P.I. (Senior Officer Present Afloat in U.S.S. SAUFLEY). During the morning underway to go alongside and fuel.

At 1600 formed Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN and departed Zamboanga for Jolo, Sulu Archipelago (Officer in Tactical Command - Captain MURPHY in U.S.S. SAUFLEY).

April 9. Steaming en route from Zamboanga, Mindanao, to Jolo, Sulu Archipelago, with ships of Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN (officer in Tactical Command - Captain MURPHY in U..S.S. SAUFLEY). Arrived Jolo Island, Sulu Archipelago, 0700, and screened landing craft as they took station in the transport area.

At 0746 commenced scheduled prelanding bombardment with U.S.S. WALLER and U.S.S. PHILIP. Ceased firing at 0828 having expended 201 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common. No casualties. Results undetermined. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 0145 of 11 April 1945).

Screened transport area until night retirement. At 1722 U.S.S. WALLER departed for Sanga Sanga escorting S.S. HARRISON EMERSON and several landing craft. At 1805 U.S.S. PHILIP departed for Zamboanga escorting units of Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN. SAUFLEY commenced night retirement to the Eastward at 1904 escorting one LST and 6 LCTs.

April 10. Steaming on night retirement Northeastward of Jolo Island, Sulu Archipelago escorting one LST and 6 LCTs. (Officer in Tactical Command - Captain MURPHY - Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN in U.S.S. SAUFLEY ).

Returned to transport area at 0600 and commenced screening to seaward, At 1000 proceeded into harbor off Jolo Town and bombarded targets as requested by our forces ashore. Completed firing at 1204 having expended 53 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common ammunition. No casualties. Results reported very good. (See SAUFLEY Action Report serial 0145 of 11 April 1945). Commenced lying to in harbor.

At 1825 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN's dispatch 100900 departed Jolo for Zamboanga escorting LST 459 and LSM 38.

April 11. Steaming en route from Jolo, Sulu Archipelago to Zamboanga, Mindanao, P.I. escorting LST 459 and LSM 38. (Officer in Tactical Command - Captain MURPHY - Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN in U.S.S. SAUFLEY.)

Arrived Zamboanga at 0700 and anchored on Santa Cruz Bank at 0746. At 1200 assumed ready duty in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN's dispatch 110300.

April 12. Anchored on Santa Cruz Bank, Basilan Strait, Mindanao, P.I. (Senior Officer Present Afloat in U.S.S. SAUFLEY). At 1200 relieved of ready duty by U.S.S. WALLER in accordance with Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO's dispatch 120135. At 1600 Captain GRAY relieved Captain J.D. MURPHY as Commander SEVENTH Amphibious Force Representative at Zamboanga.

April 13. Anchored on Santa Cruz Bank, Basilan Strait, Mindanao, P.I. (Senior Officer Present Afloat in U.S.S. SAUFLEY). Underway during morning to fuel. Assumed ready duty at 1200 in accordance with Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO's dispatch 130040. Returned to anchorage at 1244.

April 14. Anchored on Santa Cruz Bank, Basilan Strait, Mindanao, P.I. (Senior Officer Present Afloat in U.S.S. SAUFLEY). During morning Commanding Officer held personnel and living spaces inspection. At 1200 relieved of ready duty by U.S.S. PHILIP in accordance with Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO's dispatch 140155.
April 15. Anchored on Santa Cruz Bank, Basilan Strait, Mindanao, P.I. (Senior Officer Present Afloat in U.S.S. SAUFLEY). Assumed ready duty at 1200.
April 16. Anchored on Santa Cruz Bank, Basilan Strait, Mindanao, P.I. (Senior Officer Present Afloat in U.S.S. SAUFLEY). Relieved of ready duty at 1200 by U.S.S. PHILIP.
April 17. Anchored on Santa Cruz Bank, Basilan Strait, Mindanao, P.I. (Senior Officer Present Afloat in U.S.S. SAUFLEY). Assumed ready duty at 1200.
April 18. Anchored on Santa Cruz Bank, Basilan Strait, Mindanao, P.I. (Senior Officer Present Afloat in U.S.S. SAUFLEY). Relieved of ready duty at 1200 by U.S.S. PHILIP.

April 19. Anchored on Santa Cruz Bank, Basilan Strait, Mindanao, P.I. (Senior Officer Present Afloat in U.S.S. SAUFLEY). 1200 Relieved the U.S.S. PHILIP of ready duty. At 1900 Commander L. R. NEVILLE, #72477, U.S. Navy, relieved Captain C. W. GRAY, #57047, U.S. Navy, as Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN and Representative Commander SEVENTH Amphibious Force at Zamboanga in accordance with Commander SEVENTH Amphibious Force's dispatch 130122 of April 1945.

April 20. Anchored on Santa Cruz Bank, Basilan Strait, Mindanao, P.I. (Senior Officer Present Afloat in U.S.S. SAUFLEY). At 1920 underway in accordance with Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT's dispatch 180134 of April 1945 and departed Zamboanga, Mindanao for Tawi Tawi, Sulu Archipelago.
April 21. Steaming en route from Zamboanga, Mindanao, P.I. to Tawi Tawi, Sulu Archipelago, P.I. Entered Tawi Tawi Bay in the morning and anchored at 1156.

April 22-30. Anchored in Tawi Tawi Bay, Tawi Tawi Island, Sulu Archipelago, P.I. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander NEVILLE - Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN in U.S.S. SAUFLEY). On the afternoon of April 25, Senior Officer Present Afloat became Commander Task Group SEVENTY THREE POINT TWO in U.S.S. POCOMOKE.

March 1. Steaming en route to Lubang Island, P.I., in company with ships of Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT NINE POINT SEVEN consisting of LCI's and LSM's. (Officer in Tactical Command in LCI 780). Screen composed of U.S.S. HAAS and U.S.S. SAUFLEY (Commander Screen and Commander Support Force). At 0715 arrived off landing beach, Tilic Town, and commenced pre-landing bombardment. Ceased firing at 0838 having expended 350 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common and 10 rounds of White Phosphorous ammunition. No casualties. Results apparently very good, Several large fires started. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 081 of 2 March 1945).

Reformed Task Unit at 1532 and departed for Mindoro via prescribed route.

March 2. Steaming en route to Mindoro, P.I., in company with ships of Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT NINE POINT SEVEN consisting of LCI's and LSM's. (Officer in Tactical Command in LCI 780). Screen composed of U.S.S. HAAS and U.S.S. SAUFLEY. Arrived Mangarin Bay, Mindoro at 0525 and screened to seaward as Task Unit proceeded into port. Detached from Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT NINE POINT SEVEN at 0700 and departed for Subic Bay, Luzon, P.I.

Arrived Subic Bay at 1515 and anchored at 1555. Underway at 1825 to fuel. Returned to anchorage at 1950.

March 3. Anchored in Subic Bay, Luzon, P.I., Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT Vice Admiral Barbey in U.S.S. BLUE RIDGE. Underway at 0818 and went alongside port side U.S.S. LAVALLETTE in nest on port side of U.S.S. DOBBIN.

March 4-6. Moored in nest alongside port side of U.S.S. DOBBIN in berth #78, Subic Bay, Luzon, P.I., Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT Vice Admiral Barbey in U.S.S. BLUE RIDGE.

March 7. Moored in nest alongside port side of U.S.S. DOBBIN in berth #78 Subic Bay, Luzon, P.I., Senior Officer Present Afloat, Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT Vice Admiral Barbey in U.S.S. BLUE RIDGE.

At 1805 underway from U.S.S. DOBBIN and proceeded out of Subic Bay. Took departure from Subic Bay for Mindoro, P.I., at 1844 in accordance with Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT dispatch 070630.

March 8. Steaming en route to Mindoro, P.I. Arrived Mindoro at 0545, entered Mangarin Bay, and fueled. Reported to Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE for duty in accordance with Commander Task Force SEVENTY EIGHT dispatch 070630. At 0730 joined screen of Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE and took screening station in accordance with Sortie Plan. Took departure from Mindoro for Zamboanga at 0841 in accordance with Commander Amphibious Group SIX Attack Order A602-45. (Officer in Tactical Command, Rear Admiral Royal in U.S.S. ROCKY MOUNT).

March 9. Steaming en route to Zamboanga, Mindanao, P.I., in company with ships of Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE (Officer in Tactical Command - Rear Admiral ROYAL in U.S.S. ROCKY MOUNT). At 1655 echelon from Leyte consisting of seven LST's escorted by U.S.S. PHILIP and U.S.S. RUDDEROW joined the Task Group.

March 10. Steaming en route to Zamboanga, Mindanao, P.I., in company with ships of Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE (Officer in Tactical Command - Rear Admiral ROYAL in U.S.S. ROCKY MOUNT). At 0630 ships of the Task Group commenced entering the transport area South of San Mateo, Zamboanga, Mindanao. SAUFLEY assumed anti-submarine screening station South of Great Santa Cruz Island at 0832.

At 1830 rendezvoused with Task Group SEVENTY FOUR POINT THREE composed of U.S.S. ROCKY MOUNT (Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE, Rear Admiral ROYAL), U.S.S. PHOENIX, U.S.S. BOISE (Officer in Tactical Command Rear Admiral BERKEY), U.S.S. TAYLOR (CDS-21), U.S.S. NICHOLAS, U.S.S. O'BANNON, U.S.S. FLETCHER, U.S.S. JENKINS, U.S.S. ABBOTT, and U.S.S. PHILIP, in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE, visual dispatch serial 100526. Commenced night retirement to Westward of Zamboanga Peninsula.

March 11. Steaming on night retirement West of Zamboanga Peninsula, Mindanao, P.I., in company with ships of Task Group SEVENTY FOUR POINT THREE composed of U.S.S. ROCKY MOUNT (Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE, Rear Admiral ROYAL), U.S.S. PHOENIX, U.S.S. BOISE (Officer in Tactical Command Rear Admiral BERKEY), U.S.S. TAYLOR (Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY ONE), U.S.S. NICHOLAS, U.S.S. O'BANNON, U.S.S. FLETCHER, U.S.S. JENKINS, U.S.S. ABBOTT, U.S.S. PHILIP, and U.S.S. SAUFLEY.

Returned to transport area at 0700 and resumed patrol station in anti-submarine screen of the transport area. During afternoon picked up several natives who claimed to have information concerning Japanese on Basilan Island. These people transferred to U.S.S. WALLER (Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO) in accordance with verbal orders to Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO.

Joined U.S.S. PHILIP at 1800 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE visual dispatch 110630 and took stations as night stand-by fire support ship's. SAUFLEY on station in outer fire support sector south of Little Santa Cruz Island. U.S.S. PHILIP on station in Basilan Strait north of Little Santa Cruz. SAUFLEY patrolled on courses generally east and west at a speed of ten (10) knots.

March 12. Patrolling on courses east and west in outer fire support sector south of Little Santa Cruz Island, Zamboanga, Mindanao, P.I., speed ten (10) knots. At 0100 relieved U.S.S. PHILIP in inner fire support sector north of Little Santa Cruz Island, Commenced lying to.

At 0615 relieved of fire support duty, underway, and proceeded out of Basilan Strait as directed verbally by Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE. Reported to Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE POINT TWO for duty and directed by him to resume anti-submarine screening station. At 1855 ceased patrolling and rendezvoused with U.S.S. ROCKY MOUNT (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE, Rear Admiral Royal), U.S.S. ROBINSON, and U.S.S. MCCALLA in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE visual dispatch 120630. Commenced night retirement to the westward of Zamboanga Peninsula.

March 13. Steaming on night retirement westward of Zamboanga Peninsula, Mindanao, Philippine Islands, in company with U.S.S. ROCKY MOUNT (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE - Rear Admiral ROYAL), U.S.S ROBINSON and U.S.S. MCCALLA. Returned to transport area off San Mateo at 0630 and took station in anti-submarine screen.

At 0753 took station North of Great Santa Cruz Island for fire support mission. Released from this duty at 1730 and joined U.S.S. ROCKY MOUNT, U.S.S. PHILIP and U.S.S. MCCALLA for night retirement.

March 14. Steaming on night retirement Westward of Zamboanga Peninsula, Mindanao, Philippine Islands in company with U.S.S. ROCKY MOUNT (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE - Rear Admiral ROYAL), U.S.S. PHILIP and U.S.S. MCCALLA. Returned to transport area off San Mateo at 0645 and took station in anti-submarine screen.

Proceeded into anchorage area during morning and fueled from U.S.S. ROCKY MOUNT. After fueling SAUFLEY returned to screening station in Basilan Strait.

Assumed fire support duty at 1730. Shifted to screening station West of Caldera Point.

March 15. Patrolling on anti-submarine screening station West of Caldera Point standing by as fire support ship (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO - Captain SMITH in U.S.S. WALLER).

Relieved of fire support duty at 0730.

At 1600 proceeded to transport area and received ammunition from LST 1026 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE's visual dispatch 150006. Upon completion assumed station in anti-submarine screen.

March 16. Patrolling on anti-submarine screening station in Basilan Strait, Mindanao, Philippine Islands (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO - Captain SMITH in U.S.S. WALLER).

At 0630 proceeded to Santa Cruz Bank in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE's dispatch 150725 [illegible]. Underway at 0830 in company with U.S.S. WALLER (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO - Captain SMITH) escorting landing craft to Basilan Island.

Arrived off Lamitan Town, Basilan Island at 0940 Commenced prelanding bombardment at 0942. Ceased firing at 1059 having expended 198 rounds of 5"/38 AA Common and 10 rounds of white phosphorous. No casualties. Results reported good. (See SAUFLEY action report serial 092 of 18 March 1945). At 1100 troops landed. SAUFLEY and WALLER standing by for fire support.

At 1630 returned to Zamboanga transport area in accordance with Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO's verbal orders and took station in anti-submarine screen.

March 17. Patrolling on anti-submarine screening station in Basilan Strait, Mindanao, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE - Rear Admiral ROYAL in U.S.S. ROCKY MOUNT).

At 0600 in accordance with verbal orders of Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO joined U.S.S. WALLER and proceeded to Basilan Island off Lamitan Town for fire support duty. At 1030 in accordance with verbal orders of Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE returned to Zamboanga transport area in company with U.S.S. WALLER. Took station in anti-submarine screen.

March 18. Patrolling on anti-submarine screening station in Basilan Strait, Mindanao, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE - Rear Admiral ROYAL in U.S.S. ROCKY MOUNT). At 1600 joined Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE POINT TWENTY composed of U.S.S. WALLER (Officer in Tactical Command - Captain SMITH - Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO), U.S.S. PHILIP, U.S.S. SAUFLEY, 8 LST's and 19 LSM's in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE's dispatch 171411. Departed Zamboanga for Mindoro at 1650.

March 19. Steaming en route from Zamboanga, Mindanao, Philippine Islands to Mindoro, Philippine Islands in company with ships of Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE POINT TWENTY (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO - Captain SMITH in U.S.S. WALLER.

March 20. Steaming en route from Zamboanga, Mindanao, Philippine Islands to Mindoro, Philippine Islands in company with ships of Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE POINT TWENTY (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO - Captain SMITH in U.S.S. WALLER.

During the morning entered Mangarin Bay, Mindoro, Philippine Islands, fueled, received provisions, and anchored at 1907.
March 21. Anchored in Mangarin Bay, Mindoro, Philippine Islands (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Group SEVENTY TWO POINT TEN at Red Beach).

March 22. Anchored in Mangarin Bay, Mindoro, Philippine Islands. (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT TEN at Red Beach). Underway at 1047 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE dispatch 171411. Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE POINT TWENTY reformed consisting of U.S.S. WALLER (Officer in Tactical Command Captain SMITH - Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO), U.S.S. PHILIP, U.S.S. SAUFLEY, 8 LST's, 5 LSM's and U.S.S. CARONDOLET. This Task Unit departed Mindoro for Zamboanga at 1208.

March 23. Steaming en route from Mindoro, Philippine Islands to Zamboanga, Mindanao, Philippine Islands in company with ships of Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE POINT TWENTY (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO - Captain SMITH in U.S.S. WALLER).

March 24. Steaming en route from Mindoro, Philippine Islands to Zamboanga, Mindanao, Philippine Islands in company with ships of Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE POINT TWENTY (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO - Captain SMITH in U.S.S. WALLER).

Arrived Zamboanga at 0700, SAUFLEY anchored on Santa Cruz Bank at 0810. Underway at 1039 and went alongside U.S.S. ROCKY MOUNT in order to fuel ship. At 1515 in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE's visual dispatch 232215 Captain J.D. MURPHY, Representative of Commander SEVENTH Fleet Amphibious Force, came on board with his staff.

SAUFLEY underway at 1530 and proceeded to anchorage on Santa Cruz Bank.

At 1800 Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE, Rear Admiral ROYAL, in U.S.S. ROCKY MOUNT departed this area. In accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE's dispatch Captain MURPHY assumed duties of Senior Officer Present Afloat and became Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN.
March 25. Anchored on Santa Cruz Bank, Basilan Strait, Mindanao, Philippine Islands (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Captain MURPHY - Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN in U.S.S. SAUFLEY).

March 26. Anchored on Santa Cruz Bank, Basilan Strait, Mindanao, Philippine Islands (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Captain MURPHY - Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN in U.S.S. SAUFLEY).

At 1600 in accordance with Commander Destroyer Squadron TWENTY TWO dispatch 252205 SAUFLEY assumed duties as ready duty ship relieving U.S.S. WALLER.

March 27. Anchored on Santa Cruz Bank, Basilan Strait, Mindanao, Philippine Islands (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Captain MURPHY - Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN in U.S.S. SAUFLEY).

At 1600 relieved from ready duty by U.S.S. PHILIP in accordance with Commander Task Unit SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN POINT TWO dispatch 270110.
March 28. Anchored on Santa Cruz Bank, Basilan Strait, Mindanao, Philippine Islands, (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Captain MURPHY - Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN in U.S.S SAUFLEY).

March 29. Anchored on Santa Cruz Bank, Basilan Strait, Mindanao, Philippine Islands (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Captain MURPHY - Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN in U.S.S. SAUFLEY). At 1800 assumed ready duty in accordance with Commander Task Unit SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN POINT TWO dispatch 280245.

March 30. Anchored on Santa Cruz Bank, Basilan Strait, Mindanao, Philippine Islands (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Captain MURPHY - Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN in U.S.S. SAUFLEY). At 1800 relieved of the ready duty by the U.S.S. WALLER.

March 31. Anchored on Santa Cruz Bank, Basilan Strait, Mindanao, Philippine Islands (Senior Officer Present Afloat - Captain MURPHY - Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN in U.S.S. SAUFLEY). Underway at 1744 in accordance with Commander SEVENTH Amphibious Forces Representative, Zamboanga Attack Order Al-45. Formed Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN composed of U.S.S. SAUFLEY (Officer in Tactical Command - Captain MURPHY - Commander Task Group SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN), U.S.S. WALLER (Commander Task Unit SEVENTY SIX POINT TEN POINT TWO - Captain SMITH - Screen Commander), U.S.S. PHILIP, 4 YMS's, 1 SC, 1 LST, 6 LSM's and 9 LCI's. At 1800 departed Zamboanga for Sanga Sanga Island, Sulu Archipelago.

June 1 Moored starboard side to USS PHILIP in Morotai Harbor, Morotai Island, Netherlands East Indies. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE, Rear Admiral ROYAL in USS ROCKY MOUNT). 0815 USS PHILIP underway from alongside. SAUFLEY anchored. 1242 Underway and proceeded to go alongside USS GADSDEN for ammunition. Returned to anchorage area at 1633 and moored port side to USS PHILIP.

June 2 Moored port side to USS PHILIP in Morotai Harbor, Morotai Island, Netherlands East Indies. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE, Rear Admiral ROYAL in USS ROCKY MOUNT). Underway at 1534 to fuel. Completed fueling at 1636 and moored port side to USS PHILIP at 1730.

June 3 Moored port side to USS PHILIP in Morotai Harbor, Morotai Island, Netherlands Hast Indies. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE, Rear Admiral ROYAL in USS ROCKY MOUNT). Underway at 0614 in accordance with Commander Amphibious Group SIX Attack Order A606-45. At 1032 formed Slow Tow Convoy composed of MS MATTHEW FLINDERS, HMAS TIGERSNAKE and TY 35, TY 46, LT 225, TP 108, and TP 230, towing gas barges, Screen composed of USS WALLER (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander THOMPSON) and USS SAUFLEY. This unit departed Morotai for Brunei Bay, British North Borneo.

June 4 En route from Morotai, Netherlands East Indies to Brunei Bay, British North Borneo escorting Slow Tow Gasoline Convoy. Screen composed of USS WALLER (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander THOMPSON) and USS SAUFLEY.

June 5 En route from Morotai, Netherlands East Indies to Brunei Bay, British North Borneo escorting Slow Tow Gasoline Convoy. Screen composed of USS WALLER (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander THOMPSON) and USS SAUFLEY.

June 6 En route from Morotai, Netherlands East Indies to Brunei Bay, British North Borneo escorting Slow Tow Gasoline Convoy. Screen composed of USS WALLER (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander THOMPSON) and USS SAUFLEY.

June 7 En route from Morotai, Netherlands East Indies to Brunei Bay, British North Borneo escorting Slow Tow Gasoline Convoy. Screen composed of USS WALLER (Officer in Tactical Command - Commander THOMPSON) and USS SAUFLEY. At 0500 detached from convoy and directed to proceed ahead to Zamboanga, Mindanao, Philippine Islands and fuel. Arrived Zamboanga at 0800. Completed fueling from USS STONEWALL at 1440 and rejoined the convoy at 1530 at Eastern end of Basilan strait. USS WALLER proceeded ahead to Zamboanga for fueling at 1535. Lieutenant Commander SILK in USS SAUFLEY became Officer in Tactical Command.

June 8 En route from Morotai, Netherlands East Indies, to Brunei Bay, British North Borneo, escorting Slow Tow Gasoline Convoy. Screen composed of USS SAUFLEY (Officer in Tactical Command, Lieutenant Commander SILK). At 0550 USS WALLER rejoined convoy and Commander THOMPSON became Officer in Tactical Command.

June 9 En route from Morotai, Netherlands East Indies, to Brunei Bay, British North Borneo, escorting Slow Tow Gasoline Convoy. Screen composed of USS WALLER (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander THOMPSON) and USS SAUFLEY.

June 10 En route from Morotai, Netherlands East Indies, to Brunei Bay, British North Borneo, escorting Slow Tow Gasoline Convoy. Screen composed of USS WALLER (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander THOMPSON) and USS SAUFLEY.

June 11 En route from Morotai, Netherlands East Indies to Brunei Bay, British North Borneo escorting Slow Tow Gasoline Convoy. Screen composed of USS WALLER (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander THOMPSON) and USS SAUFLEY. At 0710 HMAS HAWKESBURY escorting ST 384 and tow joined the convoy.

June 12 En route from Morotai, Netherlands East Indies to Brunei Bay, British North Borneo escorting Slow Tow Gasoline Convoy. Screen composed of USS WALLER (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander THOMPSON), HMAS HAWKESBURY and USS SAUFLEY.

June 13 En route from Morotai, Netherlands East Indies to Brunei Bay, British North Borneo escorting Slow Tow Gasoline Convoy. Screen composed of USS WALLER (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander THOMPSON), HMAS HAWKESBURY and USS SAUFLEY.

June 14 En route from Morotai, Netherlands East Indies to Brunei Bay, British North Borneo escorting Slow Tow Gasoline Convoy. Screen composed of USS WALLER (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander THOMPSON), HMAS HAWKESBURY and USS SAUFLEY. During the morning entered Brunei Bay and reported to Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE POINT TWO for duty. At 1030 relieved USS ROBINSON on Screening Station in Xray-8 in accordance with orders of Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE POINT TWO, Screen Commander. At 1318 relieved on station by APD 61 and proceeded into Victoria Harbor to fuel. Completed fueling at 1751, proceeded out of Victoria Harbor, and anchored in patrol station Xray-4, Brunei Bay, as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE POINT TWO. Two air alerts during the evening.

June 15 Anchored in Brunei Bay, British North Borneo. (SOPA, Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE, Rear Admiral ROYAL in USS ROCKY MOUNT). Underway at 0858 and proceeded to radar picket station as directed by Commander Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE POINT TWO. Relieved USS BANCROFT on station at 1004. At 1424 relieved on station by USS BANCROFT and proceeded into VICTORIA Harbor and anchored. Underway at 1748 in company with USS WALLER (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander THOMPSON) and departed Brunei Bay for Miri-Lutong area in accordance with Commander Task Group SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE dispatch 141151 of June 1945. At 2303 relieved USS PHILIP and USS EDWARDS as Screen for Sweeping Unit, Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE POINT FIVE.

June 16 Steaming in company with Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE POINT FIVE on night retirement from Miri-Lutong Area, Sarawak. Screen composed of USS WALLER (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander THOMPSON) and USS SAUFLEY. During the morning mine sweepers continued operations. WALLER and SAUFLEY followed sweeps into cleared area and anchored off Lutong Town, Sarawak, at 1214. Underway at 1807 and proceeded out to sea. At 2046 formed cruising disposition with mine-sweeps and commenced night retirement.

June 17 Steaming in company with Task Unit SEVENTY EIGHT POINT ONE POINT FIVE on night retirement from Miri-Lutong Area, Sarawak. Screen composed of USS WALLER (Officer in Tactical Command, Commander THOMPSON) and USS SAUFLEY.
